reviewText: There are sooooo many options for iPhone 4 (Verizon) cases that its overwhelming!  I read...and researched...and got a headache!  I have been impressed w/ Grantwood Technology in the past for other things, so I felt fairly confident in ordering this.  I already have my iPhone in a case (ifrogz) which is a slim case, but I need something to attach to my waistband when I'm on the go (I don't like carrying things in my pocket and I certainly don't walk around my office carrying my purse)!  :)The leather is grainy in appearance and the stitching is a nice added touch = definitely gender neutral.  I love the magnetic closure flap = very secure.  The clip on the back is substantial = again, very secure.What I am MOST pleased about (because I was worried about it), not only does this fit my Verizon iPhone 4 perfectly, it even fits w/ my ifrogz case on it (its a bit tight and the fit is really ideal w/out the case, but I hate fiddling w/ taking off/putting on, so I will take the tighter fit w/ my case on any day of the week).  This means (in case I wasn't clear) that when I'm going to be in a meeting or away from my desk, I can just slip my iPhone (case and all) into this holster and go - WHOOT!  For any case thicker than mine or a bling case, you will probably have to remove prior to sliding into this holster.  The holster doesn't dislodge the plug/cover I have in the charging slot on the bottom of my phone.  Also, while I can attach my stylus to the phone in this holster, I do have to remove it every time I put my phone into or take it out of this holster = but that is not a big deal to me at all.Grantwood Technology as a seller is fabulous = great communication when needed, prompt service/shipping - I am most pleased w/ this seller and this product!

QuickFlipCase for iPhone 4 and NEW iPhone 4S (AT&T;/Verizon Versions) Grantwood Technology's Premium Leather Horizontal Flip Case (Black)The Quick Flip Case is well made, reasonably priced, stylish, has a soft protective interior lining, and my iPhone 4S fits perfectly, even with the CDMA bumper attached.  The plastic belt clip has a ratcheted pivot and the end of it is molded to securely attach to a belt.  The case remains horizontal, rides close to your side, and the magnetic cover flap stays put, yet easily lifts out of the way.  Grantwood Technology did a great job designing this case.This holster is exactly what I was looking for. If there's anything negative about it, I haven't found it.  Five stars all the way!07/15/2012, UpdateAfter the third plastic belt clip snapped off my Quick Flip Case, Grantwood Technology was nice enough to replace it with a more durable case sporting a metal clip.  Grantwood said this replacement is an older version, but I like it just as much as the Quick Flip Case.  The only real difference I can see is that the clip doesn't swivel, so the case stays in the horizontal position.  Since this is my preferred carry position, this doesn't present a problem for me.I do want to add that Grantwood Technology has been wonderful to deal with.  They stand behing their products 100-percent, and their customer service is top notch ... Five stars all the way.06/20/2012, UpdateThe bad news:I'm now on my third Quick Flip Case.  The plastic belt clip hinge broke off the first case; and the plastic belt clip assembly seperated from the back of the second replacement case.The good news:1) Grantwood Technology is excellent to do business with; they stand behind their products and guarantees completely.  Grantwood immediately shipped no-cost replacements to me without requiring the return of the defective cases.2) Before doing so they gave me the option of a full refund, a replacement, or an upgrade. I like this case so much, I chose the replacement over the refund.3) Grantwood Technology had the manufacturer correct the problem on the newest release of this case, so the clip assembly shouldn't seperate from the case again.Although I took one star away from the original five star rating, I still really like this case.  And, if this one should become defective, I know Grantwood Technology will continue to do the right thing and offer a full refund.

A very nice holster for the iPhone. First, to answer a question I had before I bought it: Yes, it will hold an iPhone 3G that's inside a Griffin Clarifi case and likely other cases of similar bulk.I like that it's a magnetic closure; no "rip" of Velcro when I try to sneak it out of the holster during a meeting.It holds the iPhone snugly, perhaps a little too snuggly at the moment, but as the leather relaxes over time I prefer it to be a little tight to begin with.I prefer the horizontal holster as it's low profile and stays out of the way. The belt hook is reinforced with metal at the end so it won't fray and get in the way as you try to get it on your belt over time. It's just a very nice, relatively low cost holster.UPDATE 6/7/09: This was a very nice holster, but I find the seams starting to rip already on the end straps. If I could I would replace the five stars with just two for the lack of durability.
summary: Good overall holster for an iPhone, but doesn't stand up to wear and tear

reviewText: This is my 3rd case for my iPhone 3GS. The first one was OtterBox. The clip-on was not secure enough. My second one was Blue Harbor case. It was pretty good except the belt clip was WAY-TOO-TIGHT! So I bought my 3rd one, which is this one. I decided on it after reading many favorable reviews. I got it yesterday and I've been extremely happy with it. It securely holds the iPhone in it. The belt clip is not too tight but tight enough that it won't come off the belt. I highly recommend this one to anyone with an iPhone 3GS.
The best thing is it works. It did not cost much and charges my iPhone.

I would return it, except it would cost that much just to return it.The thing charges.  I'll give it that.But* when charging, it causes the iPhone to emit a very noticeable high-pitched sound during play.* the cord is laughably short.* the craftsmanship is, well, I guess what you should expect for a few bucks.  I had to push and wiggle it into my (Dodge Ram 1500) lighter outlet to get the proper connection.  I took it out and in my bag for a day or two, and it fell apart (the tip fell off).I bought this as an alternative to the $30 AT&T; one, but I guess I'll have to cough that up to get something with a little quality.I think this product should not be on the market, even granting the caveat "you get what you pay for."  It represents itself as an alternative to the brand one; it isn't.

This unit feels cheaply made, which, considering it was only a penny plus s&h, is the case. However, it has worked flawlessly. Buy one for each vehicle you drive.  Keeps the phone nice and charged up on those long trips.

I guess you get what you pay for.  This thing worked initially, but it gradually started to smell like a small electrical fire.  After 6 months of occasional use, the thing burned out entirely.For S&Gs; I took the thing apart.  It's not horribly made, but it does have a design flaw that is practically guaranteed to cause electrical failure.  The failure won't burn up your car or burn out your iPhone, but it will stop working.
summary: Worked for a while, then burned out

reviewText: I priced this charger at Best Buy and it was a lot more expensive then what I paid here in Amazon and it does the job just as good as the more expensive charger at AT&T
keep up the good work and thanks for selling this for such a low price

reviewText: The charger works well at all times so far. The price is so low that is unbelievable.
I would purchase it twice. Looks great and works well. Easy to use. No installation required and looks stylish. I would purchase again.

came in fast....works perfectly fine charges fast not like how the other reviews where they mentioned it charged slow...it got roasted when they plugged it in..didnt go in the charging dock right...my charger that arrived to me is the complete opposite of all of that...mine works perfectly fine as it should

reviewText: Nothing fancy about this charger - just a basic car charger for the iPhone.  Works for 3G, no issues or complaints.  Hard to beat the price!

reviewText: I bought three of these things about a year ago.  I gave one to my girlfriend, one to my brother, and I kept the other one for myself.At first they worked great.  But within less then a year, each of them failed.  None of them work now.In short, these things must have some kind of design flaw, resulting in a failure after a few months.  Don't waste your money.  There are many other similar products on the market for a similar price.
I WAS REALLY PLEASED WITH THIS 3G CAR CHARGER. I USED IT WHEN I HAD MY 3G CELL PHONE. I HAVE SINCE UPGRADED, BUT IT SERVED ITS PURPOSE AT THE TIME.

I bought this with the hope i can finally charge it on the go in my car.....but to my dismay the plug is to fat to fit through the case opening.  I went with a USB cable instead.  If you have an Otterbox, don't waste your money on this.

reviewText: The charger works good in my car. Looks sleek, well made and last for a long time. i had this charger for 3 plus years and still working. I wish this charger will work for the iPhone 5 but it doesn't.

reviewText: convenient to have in your car for your iphone.  bought it for iphone4 but now use it for iphone5 with an adapter.

At first I couldn't get it working with my iPhone 3G because it has to be pushed all the way in very tightly to my car lighter/power adapter.  That is, other chargers just slide in and fit but this fits a little loose.  However, whenever I plug it in and push it in tight it works flawlessly.  I also like that it's retractable and has a cool blue light.  It doesn't look like the picture.  And c'mon, it's less than a buck. If you bought it from a physical store, it'd be $20, or $30 from your cell phone service provider.
Works just like it's supposed to for the wife's iPhone 3GS.  She's happy with it so that's all that matters.

This item was delivered in just a couple of days. Of course, for the price I wasn't expecting much, but I was quite suprised when I got it. The charger works great. I've had it a couple of months now and use it all the time. No complaints.
Excellent value...good quality...good function...no problems with it other than the typical difficult entry into the phone itself...which seems to be prevalent on all chargers for iPhones.
My husband really like the charger.  It means his needs of charger his phone.  So, nothing really great or not.

This product worked great for a couple weeks but after I while I noticed the phone was no longer charging. The red light still comes on, but the phone does not receive a charge. Tested it in another vehicle with same results. Not sure if recent iPhone updates had anything to do with it or if it just died. Looks like I'll have to spend the extra $ for a name brand charger.
summary: Worked briefly with iPhone 3G then stopped

reviewText: The car charger works fine, but the wire cable to the charger is very thin and easy to be damaged, I rather prefer thicker wire for durability, but for the price, I am satisfied.

The Symbian OS was not user friendly and nothing like the standard Nokia OS.The Blackberry Bold 9000 is very user friendly and the UI is intuitive.  Call quality and the speaker phone is very good. very relievable fone couldn't ask for more works perfecto wi fi perfect everything good my friend the owner is happy

I've tried 6 bluetooth headsets, and this is the first one I can wear with comfort. It combines in the ear with an over the ear plastic piece. All of the others I tried pushed too hard in my ear, or the clip pressed against my outer ear. This design has the over-the ear loop sprouting directly behind the in-ear speaker. Better fit.Sound is great, easy to use. Simple and great design!
summary: At last! A device I can wear

reviewText: My husband loves this bluetooth so much that this is the second time he has me purchase it. Sound is awesome... the earpiece isn't too big where it hurts your ear and the button work is easy. For example... it won't turn on accidently if in your pocket and it is easy to adjust the volume... and so on.All in all... great product.Thanks Amazon!!
I like this bluetooth, due to the qulity and I hear perfectly on it. Great product and price is worth it

I bought this as a replacement for a Plantronics Voyager 520. (Lost it, so needed a quick replacement.) I found the 520 to be very comfortable. The way it channeled sound into the ear worked very well.Pros:* Has a mute function. I listen in on lots of telecons for business, so I really needed this.* Sound quality is very good, both for both ends (if you can keep it in your ear)* Buttons are easy to access and operate.Cons:* I have not been able to find any way to make this fit me. With the tips that is came with, it managed to be both painful, and yet fall out easily. any turn of the head and it would be hanging there in space. I also had a hard time hearing it because it would end up too far out of my ear. I could use the oblong tip and get it wedged to where it would stay better, but it hurt terribly. I tried a 3rd party ear gel, and that holds it a bit better, but still hurts. I end up having to push it back in every couple minutes, especially if I'm moving around at all. And for the record, I've never had any problems with stereo earbuds or ear-canal phones.* Related to fit, when trying to stuff it back in your ear, it is really easy to accidentall hit the big call control button and cut off the call.I really can't imagine how anyone can use this for any time at all. I've made it work for several weeks, but I'm looking for a replacement.

The "answer" switch is too close to the off switch and sometimes is hard to answer.. Sound quality is OK, nothing to write home about.. overall it works as indicated but not a super duper product to write home about...Also is kind of hard to tell which way increases the volume or decreases it...

The main reason i got this case is because i loved how you could see the chrome edge around the screen. It shows it this way in the pictures and even on video reviews i've seen. Well, it seems they have changed the design of the case and the chrome edge is no longer visible. The case looks pretty cool, but it does not have as much grip as i thought it would and it is a lint trap!

My phone is an iPhone 3GS. I own an incase slider, griffin elan form and a snap on case (brand name forgotten). All are good cases with the incase taking top honors esthetically. The problem with all three is that shock protection is less than than adequate in my opinion. I haven't had to test their shock protection fortunately but all three are hard plastic cases. They will more than adequately protect from scratches but I have my doubts about their ability to protect from a drop onto tile or concrete. Which brings me to the case-mate vroom. I bought it for the novelty of the tread design but it has become my daily case for several reasons. Without being overly  bulky (ie. otterbox), it has enough soft silicone material to almost guarantee a safe landing onto a hard surface. The fit isn't as tight as I would like but it has proven to me that it stays put. For example, when I squeeze this into and out of my leather holster (DLO), it feels like the case may not be strong enough to stand up to this day in and day out. Yet every time I remove it from the holster, the camera lens is centered perfectly in the vroom's camera port. This is a pretty good indication that the case isn't stretching and that it stays in place. Another nice feature is the material's ability to stay put if left on a car seat. The the silicone has just enough friction to keep it in place in a moving car on cloth car seats. I haven't tried it on leather or vinyl. Lastly, the price is great. The incase and others are 2-3 times more expensive. Great case, great price.
summary: All things considered, best case I've found..

reviewText: This is a low cost iPod cover in the pattern of a tire tread - looks as if it was made from an old tire like a poor kid's sandal in South America. Pretty cool and functional too. I like it.
it has a good design. but dont fit well the iphone.was a mistake. but i already get another "otter" this really fit.

I picked this case because of the unique tire tread pattern.  It has a pretty high cool factor, and way more interesting than the regular silicone sleeves.  My only complaint is that the case is completely flush with the face of the iPhone.  It makes for a very clean look, but offers no protection to the screen in case of a drop.  If it extended just a tiny bit above the surface, it would protect the screen.  Oh well, maybe in the redesign.Also, if you're thinking this might fit your 1st generation iPhone, it won't.
summary: cool pattern and good protection, but still need to protect your screen by other means

reviewText: The product does allow lots of dust to stick to it but it is rubber... I think all of these case would have this issue unless it is a hard rubber.  The case does not add a lot of extra thickness to the phone and it is very easy to remove.  I feel with the rubber casing, that in case of a drop that it should help with the shock from a drop but not if it goes screen first.  There is about 1mm of rubber that is proud looking at the screen from the side.  I believe that if the unit was to be drop screen first that it would simply come out of the rubber shell.  It comes with a screen protector that is very clear and seems so far not to scratch too badly.  I would buy again but don't think it adds as much protection as a case that surrounds the entire case.  So I'm going the route of being very careful since I like cases like this one... I hate the extra thickness with cases that fully encloses the phone.Comes with the rubber case, screen protector, card to squeeze out bubbles while installing the screen protector, and micro cleaning cloth.
OtterBox is a good brand, but is simply huge, is great for when you have small kids it protects you phone, but otherwise it's just to big.

awesome case. i am what some would consider heavy handed, and thus far i have been turly amazed by the durability of this case. i truly do recommend it especially for those in the law enforcement field. the only warning that i give its a bit bulky but it does its j0b by protecting your phone!
This case is durable, but the outer rubber tends to stretch out and become very loose. The inner hard shell, is durable! I would recommend this item to others.

This case is excellent.  I have read many reviews about the bubbles, but a little dust of baby powder solves the problem perfectly.  I have dropped my phone several times since owning the case with no damage whatsoever to my phone.After owning the case several months I contacted the company and received the best customer service I have ever received from any company - bar none.  A great case and a great company!  Highly recommended.

Me + cell phone + gravity = Yikes!I am very pleased with this case. It is durable and provides very good protection for your iPhone without making it overly bulky like most "armor" cell phone cases do.I would suggest that once you get it, before you start messing with it, go to manufacturer's web site ([...]) and find this item, then clik VIDEO. This will play a YouTube video explaining how to take the case apart, install the iPhone, and put it all back together.Also, make sure to completely clean the screen of the iPhone, the inside of the screen protector of the case, and the external surfaces of the iPhone. With any luck you will never need to remove the iPhone again. I used a microfiber cloth intended to clean eyeglasses and it worked perfectly.I say 'almost perfect' in the title of this case because while using the belt clip as a desktop prop to landscape viewing (explained in the above-mentioned video) you can not connect the charging/sync cable. This is a small bummer, but not a big deal. If it were possible to give a rating of 4.9 stars I would have.Update: My current opinion after three months....Belt holster: Not very good. The phone comes out of it too easy as others have said.  I simply carry thing thing in my pocket.The case itself: I can't imagine carrying around my iPhone without it. It's been dropped to hard surfaces a number of times and the phone is still perfect.  The screen and the 'oil slick' problem: I figured the screen protector would get scratched up and whatnot eventually. So what I did was remove the iPhone from the case, then I puched on the screen protector from the front inward until it popped out. Then I took an exacto knife and scraped off the remaining glue residue from where the screen portector was glued in place. Then I bought a $10 kit of three adhesive screen protectors. these come in regular, anti-glare, privacy, etc. take your pick. Put the adhesive screen portector on the iPhone (after carefully cleaning the screen) then put the iPhone back in the case.  Using this method, if the screen protector gets crummy looking, you can always take the whole thing apart and put a new protector on.  I just did this screen protector replacement after three months constant use. The case was full of dust and lint, which cleaned-up well enough.  Once I wiped all the dust off the iPhone itself, it looked like it was brand freakin new. Pull off the old protector, put on a new one, reassemble the Otterbox, and I'm good for another three or four months.
The product did not work as promised...it did not fit my iPhone 3G, so had to return it back. Amazon was prompt in returning the refund..

This case is exactly what I was looking for! I have gone through so many cases prior to ordering this one. This one is by far the best protection you can give your iPhone, bar none! It does add a little bulk to the phone but the protection it provides far out weighs that issue. I can now take my iPhone anywhere I go and feel safe that it is protected. I toss it in my gym bag and never have to worry about it.  Now on bike rides and hikes my phone comes along.So if you are like me and have been through several cases and are looking for max protection for your iPhone just order this case and be done with your search.

This case is awesome but has one minor flaw. There are sometimes watermarks or bubbles under the screen. Good news is that it very easy to fix!You can use almost anything to clean the screen of the otterbox and iphone screen.then use a blow dryer on a low setting dry off both the otterbox screen and the iphone screen. Keep the blow dryer about 12" away from each and it doesn't get very hot at all. Do this for a minute or so.Then when you put the otterbox case together there will no NO bubbles at all.I used windex to clean my iphone and otterbox screen. Worked perfectly on both phones I tried it on.
summary: THE BEST FIX FOR THE BUBBLES UNDER THE SCREEN!

reviewText: loved it! was easy to put together. had one issue, and that was that the screen would bubble up. i used a little of baby powder but that didn't work. so what i did was i popped the case screen protector and i put a screen protector. looked good.

I originally order oneOtterBox Defender Case for iPhone 3G, 3G S (Black)and one OtterBox Defender Series 3G iPhone Case - Black/Yellow.  I had to return both of them.  I returned theOtterBox Defender Case for iPhone 3G, 3G S (Black)one because it was missing the speaker covers, and it appeared to have already been previously used.  I returned the OtterBox Defender Series 3G iPhone Case - Black/Yellow because it didn't properly fit the 3G it didn't have an opening for the silent switch.I then ordered 2 moreOtterBox Defender Case for iPhone 3G, 3G S (Black)'s and they appear to be exactly the same.  However, one has the oil spot issue and the other doesn't.Drop and Shock: Protection against drop, bump and shockI have had first hand experience that this is true - I was getting out of the truck and caught the belt clip on the seat belt - Only the phone drop to the side walk and bounced - no damage.Water Protection: Not tested or recommended for water protectionLuckily I haven't had an occasion to test this feature.Dust Protection: Dust does not enter in a sufficient quantity to interfere with satisfactory operation of equipmentI also have first hand knowledge of this.  We went to a dirt track race a couple of weekends ago and it gets pretty dusty - I had no issues with get dust inside the case and it wiped off nicely.I recommend this case to anyone who has the 3G iphone.

If you did not know what it is like to hold a naked iPhone, you would think that it was made with this OtterBox Defender Case.  It is soft to the touch yet rugged. All the buttons are accessible and the camera has a protective shield.It takes a certain dexterity to applying the scratch cover to the front surface. These covers  also need periodic replacement. Henry Ford said you could buy the Model T in any color as long as it is black. Someone forgot to make a red version of this critter; it would have been sporty, however black is always sophisticated. This does make the iPhone look a little like it is on steroids.No I am not about to drop it to see if it works. I have however seen the results of a friend that did not front for an OtterBox Defender Case and his shattered face had an interesting pattern to it. (The phone's shattered face also.)

My boyfriend and I recently got new iPhones and two of these cases along with them.I can't explain how amazing this case is!It protects the phone almost excessively.-Allows access to all plug-ins and buttons-literally half the price ($19 per case vs. $39)-fits into the belt clip SECURELY (IF you connect it correctly! Those people who said it comes off the belt clip easily must have been placing it facing out, but it's supposed to be facing inward. There's a sticker in the belt clip that shows this)We love our cases!

My husband loves his new otterbox.  He can wear it on his hip or put it in his pocket.  The only problem is we had to buy him a new car charger because the charging portal hole on the phone is too small for his previous car charger.

So I've had the case for about two months now... Yes, it does protect your phone from anything, the "Fort Nox" of iPhone cases, but it has its down sides too:Pros:Great fit, great design, ultimate protectionCons: the built in screen protector get bubbles in it frequently, the bottom where you insert the "usb" is positioned so far up that it makes it not work with almost every cool iphone accessory out there.For example: I have used the Liquid Aux car adapter for over a year (which you simply slide your iphone into it and it charges and runs the music through your aux port) With the Otterbox the port is so far up in the case you can't plug your iphone into anything that play music or charges your phone, (except the original apple charger).It is hands down the best for protection, but unless you beat your phone into the ground on a daily basis I wouldn't recommend this case.Functionality always wins, and this case doesn't cut it.
I love it because when I need to add protector that really works. Also you cannot beat the price !!!Thanksbigwill360

heavy duty box for and outdoors person.Is moisture resistant and has saved my phone from moisture damage at least twice.The clear cover sticks to your phone screen giving an oily contact appearance.  I fixed that by drying really well and putting a tiny pinch of powder on it then blowing it off.  Put it together, no more oily spots.Is bulky and doesn't fit well in the windshield mounted iPhone holder.The holder that comes with it is terrible.  The phone falls out easily but since the case is so tough, your phone won't break your phone.  Since the holder is so bad, you'll put your phone in your pocket which works good however, lint will build up on your camera lens which the Otterbox seems to 'hold'.  Occasional swabbing with a q-tip cleans your camera lens.Don't substitue with another brand.  If you are an outdoors person, you need this protection.

I got this for my grand daughters phone as she is 9 and drops all kinds of things..it was my old phone and gave it to her as an I pod but still.. it needed protection. this saved it many may times I am sure!

I had high hopes for this product because this was recommended by the dealer as the best protection for my iphone. Within the first few weeks, my iphone popped out of my holder at least 4 times and caused it to drop onto concrete floor. Fortunately, the inner shell was hard so my iphone did not break. Don't buy this product if you want to wear it on your belt because the clip on does not work!
This thing hasn't failed me in about 40 drops.  I still used the old iPhone as an iPod and Alarm Clock.

I was in my local ATT store looking at iPhones and asked about cases.  Yes they had cases. OTTERBOX in fact. OK show me one...Here comes an iPhone sailing across the store... BOUNCE BOUNCE BOUNCE SPIN STOP. No DAMAGE! They said they do that 20 times a day every day !I'm sold!

I used this case for two years and today I popped it off my iPhone 3GS because it got too dirty in all of the crevices.  It has a lot of deep openings that trap dirt and it accumulates after a while.  Otherwise the protection is excellent.  I used the powder trick on the screen (see other posts for the powder tip) and after that I never experienced screen bubbles.  This case is really for exposing your phone to hard core abuse.  Looking back, I think it was a bit overkill for my purpose (occasional home construction work) and I would have been ok with a thinner case.  But, this case is cheap insurance if breaking your iPhone at the roller derby would be a personal disaster.
summary: Ultimate protection, but hard to clean

reviewText: This is an awesome product. I work in a mechanic shop and am constantly dropping my phone and bumping it in to random stuff.. But, with the otterbox I no longer stress about the idea of my phone dropping... I don't even try to catch it when it drops anymore! PERFECTION! All connection work without removing the case and the button operation works great too!
While a bit big for someone people, this is a very well engineered case for the iPhone.  I am really disappointed they do not make a Otterbox case for my new phone, the mytouch4g.
This was a good product when I used it. It was just too bulky and got tired of how bulky it was. It does a good job at protecting.
I had it for a couple if years. I dropped the phone a couple times on cement floor and the iPhone was not damaged. Need to say nothing else

This is great for protecting the Iphone. This is the second one I bought the first one I actually broke took a lot of work but I finally broke it only dropped it a dozen times from several different hieghts

Screen:This is a great case and a great investment for you iphone!  We use this case to protect our iphone 3gs.  If you have ever put on a screen protector on the screen of a phone or other electronic and you do not get the air bubbles out, that is what the other viewers are describing.  However, after you purchase your case, go to an Apple Store and purchase an, "anti-glare film set for iphone  3G/3GS" screen protector.  The key is "anti-glare"! Ask them to put it on your phone.  The young man took the phone out of the case, sprayed a cleaner on the screen and the otterbox screen.  I still saw the mark so he cleaned it again.  The cloth he used appeared to be the problem so I let him use the cloth that came with my sunglasses and that worked leaving no marks/air bubbles on the screen.  The screen is beautiful.  Do not get confused with the regular screen protectors for the iPhone because we had that on the phone prior to the anti-glare and it did not work because the mark was still on the phone.To sum it up, you will have two screen protectors on your phone, the anti-glare protector as well as the one that is on the otterbox.Model number of sorts is PIA-06E which may be the number for the original iphone as well as the 3g/3gs phone. If you have a 3g or 3gs iphone, make sure the front of the screen protector package reads, 3g/3gs because if you buy it without that specification on the front, then you will probably be buying the screen protector for the original iphone and that protector does not completely cover the 3g phones.You get two protectors that cover the 3gs phone well for 14.95.  It is made by power support.  It is sold on Amazon but as I stated I had great success with the Apple employee making the application.The belt clip/case that comes with the otterbox:In order for the phone to stay in the case, you MUST place the phone in the holder with the screen facing your body and the BACK of the phone facing away from the body.  If I were approaching you, I should be able to see the apple on the back of the phone and not the screen of your phone.  If you do so, there is not a problem with the case and the phone as well as the safety of the phone.Sound:We do not have any problems with hearing the phone ring or any of the sounds that the phone makes.Water protection:I was told from the employee at the apple store that if the phone encased with the otterbox drops in water, if the phone is recovered within 3 seconds, then the odds is that the phone will be okay.  That is, if you have all the openings closed on the phone.  Therefore, it is imperative that the cover openings remain closed on the case at all times.Iphone warranty:If you purchased the extended warranty the warranty extended or not will not cover the phone if the phone is dropped in water, if the screen breaks or if the screen is in a bunch of pieces.  Therefore, purchasing the otterbox is a no brainer!
summary: Solution to RID water mark/Oil Slick look!!!!

reviewText: It is armour!!! Somebody may complain hard to put off...insteads you can protect your prescious iphone more safe!!! Worth buying.

I ordered this for my husband's iPhone almost three years ago and it is still keeping his iPhone safe and secure. He isn't gentle at all with his phone and this has kept it so safe. It is worth every penny since it has saved me hundreds of dollars in not having to replace his phone. Now he is wishing it wasn't such a great case so he could justify upgrading his technology!

I'm paranoid about dropping any smart phone and winding up with a brick.  This thing is the best protection you can get at a good price.Cons?  Well, using the edge of the screen takes some getting use to since the case starts right at the edge, but you get used to that.  Other cases are slimmer fitting, but they don't offer this much protection.Also, charging, headphones and silent switch are buggers since they have covers you have to pull back to access.  I suppose you could take a razor knife and carefully cut these covers off if you want to.  You can have top-notch protection or ease of access, but I doubt both are possible.You also won't be able to use most any docking station-type product, but I know other iPhone users who use ANY protective cover (no matter how slim) run into this problem.  All the products are made for the iPhone/iTouch without any case or protective cover.

I am very dissapointed with this product.....The day i received it i thought this thing looks great and with the built in screen protector to it makes it even  better, for little over $12.00 i paid i thought this is a steal. Well fast forward over a week later, the outer layer of the black silicon skin starts to rub off, make it look like some dirt that needs to be wiped off. Worse, this thing is a lint magnet, it's like I'm holding a furry kitten against my ear every time i use my iphone.....As the saying goes, you get what you pay for..........

I was looking for a case that would really protect the iphone. These phones are not tough. This case is the one. Very well built and a perfect fit. The only problem i found was the annoying water mark on the screen caused by the membrane sticking to the screen. That was solved using a trick i found on youtube. A extremely lite dusting of baby powder dust on the inside of the membrane cures the water mark. This case is worth every penny and after years of different phones and even more cases this is the best one yet. It does increase the size of the phone and gives it a no slip grip which is perfect for me.
This case is the best! I read all the reviews and to debate the Con of the screen, *you need to buy the "Anit-Glare" from the apple store. It has a matte finish making this case the best!

This case fits perfectly, and is one of the most protective cases available. I have no trouble using the touch screen and everything is clear and bright. I've owned Apple products for years and most cases cause some problems with docking, especially more protective ones that are thicker, that's just a given. You don't buy this type of case and wine because it wont fit your dock. If your looking for solid protection for your investment that those thin cases can't provide this is it. If your concerned about adding a little bulk or showing off your iPhones good looks maybe another case may be your best option.
A truely great item to have when your phone needs protection.  My advice is to get it.

Don't get me wrong, this is a good case, but not any better than a couple others on Amazon for half the cost with free shipping if you are a Prime Member.  I contacted Otterbox Customer Service and they were very unresponsive and abrupt.  I have three cases (two iPhones) and I would rate this behind a popular one on Amazon.The case offer good protection, but the screen protector makes it difficult to view the phones apps in bright light.  Also the snap on holster does not hold the phone if you are wearing a jacket.  The clip style holster barely hold the phone in place and the jacket rubbing against the phone is enough for the phone to fall to the ground.  You need to be careful because if you are on grass, snow or in a loud area you will not hear the phone fall.
summary: Is ok, but there are better ones for half the cost

reviewText: I love it and better than I expect.  I'm buying one for my wife's Iphone.  I love how it really protects my iphone and its new.  Also, its was a great price.  Thanks!

I've got a collection of cases for my original iPhone and my new 3Gs.  This one is by far the most protective of any I've had or seen.  If you're going to be outdoors bumping around it's an excellent choice.  It also does an great job of keeping sand out of the phone when I go to the beach.Here are a few more points of interest:Pro's- Exceptional protection- Reasonably priced- Nearly seals all openings to the phone from sand, splashed water, etc.- The belt clip holds the phone very securely.- The design and build are high quality and sturdyCon's- It takes some effort to get the case on and off- The case is bulky- It won't allow charging the phone in my universal base from Apple- The screen protector does create an oil slick like effect.  I've gotten used to this now.If you want a high level of protection this is an ideal case otherwise something less bulky might be a better choice.
summary: I like it, but not the right case for everyone

reviewText: Nice sturdy box with rubber outside to protect phone. Comes with screen cover, so if you already have one on the phone that makes three and it does not slow down the function of the phone.  Would definitely purchase this item if you treasure your iPhone! VERY Reasonably priced, as the phone store wanted $40 more than I paid on this site.  I have recommended this site to many of my friends who have iPhones.

unit holds phone well, the unit is so very well protected even from rain, the clip that holds the unit is well made also, the phone pushes into the clip holder so sometimes if u hit the unit against something it does come lose, but not that often thats why 4 stars.
Perfect case, leaves your phone well protected!!!! Great price for the same product that costs way more.....a definite great buy.

Protected the phone well for almost one year. The phone fell many times and it was fine. However the otterbox broke after almost a year, but that was fine, because my son upgraded his phone. Works well.
This this is amazing. I have dropped my IPone several times and no broken screen. The holder does a good job of holding the phone even when you bump in to things.

I bought this case to protect the iphone, since replacement was too expensive and AT&T; Corporate stores do not offer insurance.  Though the case makes the phone bulky, it also made it easy to toss around, drop off of bars, and easier to find when digging for it in a bag.BUT DOES IT WORK?? Yes, absolutely.  On Christmas, we were all hanging out and relaxing, my basset hound at my feet happily making chomping and chewing noises on her bone....or so we thought.  Turns out the dog was chewing on the iPhone, not a bone, and had been chewing on it for some time.  Though she managed to tear off a little flap, and put a dent with her fang in the case, the iphone itself was protected perfectly.  My dog has massive chompers; she snaps bones easily.  She was chewing on this for some time, NO DAMAGE TO THE PHONE.  In fact, I can still use the case, though will probably replace it for cosmetic appearances.FIVE STARS for working well; my dog put it to the test.  Thank you otterbox for saving my phone, and my dog thanks you as well -- it saved her from getting into a lot of trouble!RECOMMENDED!!!!!
summary: Yes, it is more than worth it

reviewText: Got this at a great Amazon price. Fabulous protection for iPhone and the workplace. Followed other reviewers suggestions for the echo and the oily shield. Couldn't be happier.

I just recieved my two otterbox cases - one black and one black/yellow.  The black/yellow had an "installation" sticker which showed how to put the iphone into the belt clip holder.  It is a bit counter intuitive - it is FACE side *IN*!  If one puts the phone in face side out yes, it will more than likely fall out.  If however, you put the phone in face side IN (so the screen doesn't get scratched) it is securely in place. And no, the black case did not have the instruction sticker.I also concur that the additional "heft" of the case is a plus for myself and my wife. I can't imagine trying to hold onto the iphone without something around it - to say nothing of the repair bills.Larry

I liked this case very much! It was nice to have a case that would protect my iPhone. I am honestly not the one to drop my phone as I hold my phone like it was a baby. I will say that it felt great to know that if there became a time and I dropped my phone, it would be protected.
Keeps phone from cracking and braking when dropped. I am happy I bought this for my husband, he is hard on phones. Well worth the money.

THIS CASE IS EXCELLENT, I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH ABOUT THE QUALITY AND PROTECTION IT GIVES THE IPHONE.  I HAD THE OTTERBOX COMMUTER TL WHICH IS REALLY GOOD CASE TOO, BUT I FELT NERVOUS ABOUT MY IPHONE TIL I PUT THIS CASE ON. ITS AWESOME, AND I DONT THINK ITS TOO BULKY GIVES THE IPHONE A BETTER GRIP WHEN HOLDING IT ETC.FOR THE WATERMARK ON SCREEN USE THE YOUTUBE TECHNIQUE WITH BABY POWDER IT WORKS GREAT.  WHEN TEXTING THE SIDES CAN BE TOUGH IN PORTRAIT MODE, BUT SMALL CON FOR ALL THAT THIS CASE GIVES YOUR IPHONE FOR PROTECTION. AND CAN JUST SWITCH TO LANDSCAPE THEN NO PROBLEM.29.00 IS GREAT PRICE AND WELL WORTH IT FOR A CASE OF THIS CALIBER...FITS MY IPHONE 3GS PERFECTLY.I ALSO HAVE ZAGG INVISI SHIELD ON AND TOUCH RESPONSE IS STILL VERY GOOD ALMOST UNNOTICEABLE DIFFERENCE.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS CASE TO ALL EVEN IF NOT HARD ON PHONES, OUR IPHONES ARE 300.00 INVESTMENTS BETTER HAVE GOOD CASE FOR THEM.BOUGHT ON AMAZON WAS EASY AND HAD GOOD WAY OF TRACKING SHIPPING INFO.

I purchased a Defender for my wife (the pink/black one) when she got her iPhone, and eventually got a black one for myself. First, the good things: it offers excellent protection from drops, scrapes and the occasional rain storm. When your phone is clipped face-in on the belt clip it's pretty much impervious to most shock and any kind of screen damage.About the only thing it won't protect against is getting dropped in a body of water. It's water resistant, but NOT waterproof. Most of the phone is covered by plastic or silicone except for two holes on the bottom for the speakers, and a cloth cover over the part where you put your ear. I've had my iPhone in the Defender for about 3 months and it looks as shiny as the day I bought it.A few caveats: the plastic film that covers the screen has a weird oily "pooling" effect that's distracting. I've found that a light dusting of corn starch on the side that contacts the iPhone will get rid of it for a while.The silicone outer casing picks up dirt and lint like nobody's business. I have to wipe it down with a damp cloth several times a week or it's a phone-sized fuzzball. A minute in a blue jeans pocket will coat the thing. This is true for any case with this kind of non-shiny silicone though.The case adds a significant amount of bulk to the iPhone, so if you have small pockets or don't like the idea of clipping it to your belt all the time, look elsewhere.
summary: Great Protection, Pain to Keep Clean

reviewText: I like how it keeps your phone safe in it I've dropped it several times and it still didn't break

Considering that the new iPhone 4 has come out, this almost perfect case for the 3G/3Gs has come down big in price.I finally got an iPhone after my previous contract just expired. They tried to sell me a screen protector (which is just a slate of static plastic cover on top of the glass) for 12 bucks.  12 bucks for a puny piece of rectangular plastic - ridiculous!  With this purchase I got the screen cover, a hard shell case, a rubber silicone cover.  Also, you get a belt clip that works just wonderful.All the controls of the iPhone are accessible while your phone is in th case.  The openings that are vulnerable to dust and liquid are sealed by the silicone plugs except the microphone and speakers which is obvious. By the way, the silicone case and the plugs are all in one single unit of construction, and so you don't have to worry about losing anything.  I would say that the case makes it water resistant, but not completely waterproof.  It will protect it from casual splashes of water but not if you happen to drop it in the pool or tub.* In regards to the problem about the watermark, the baby powder trick works! There are a lot of videos online that will show you how.  You will not be pouring the powder on your iPod or the screen case.  You just have to place and hold the baby powder on top of a table, put the case screen about 6 inches away, and then do a baby pump just enough to make a small puff of fairy dust.  And that's it.  You're done.A couple of cons:- This will double the thickness of your iPhone.- The only switch that is hard to reach while in the case is the lock button on the upper left.  They should have made the opening a little bigger.
summary: The almost perfect case for the iPhone 3G/S

reviewText: Recommend for all.  Does the job of protecting the phone just doesn't _slip__ easily into a pocket which might be important for some.
Case fits phone well but is a little bulky.  Some of the features were more difficult to work with. It gives the phone good protection.

Wow!Love the thought process that went into creating this piece of equipment.Layers of protection with materials that are durable and the package still comes off pleasing to the eye.The initial layer of the  hardshell box is ingenious but to also have the screen protector built in shows quality through and through. Add to that the final layer of the rubber (armored) sleeve and it transforms this phone into a tough-phone. I've read previous reviews where there were some issues with clarity between the screen and screen protector, I was careful to take a damp lint-free cotton rag and wipe the screen thoroughly and then dried it and let the phone sit for a minute before carefully sliding the phone into the hardshell case. No fuss/No muss.I paid a substantial amount of $$$ for my unlocked iPhone and to me this was a worthy investment. I've only had 3 phones in 15 years so I viewed this as an insurance policy with a duration of 5 years.Seriously considering getting an OtterBox for my new iPad. If you view this piece of equipment more as an investment in protection for your phone rather than a fashion accessory, it's more than worth it.

Bought this for my iPhone 3GS for use on the golf course.I've had a couple of drops, but it protected my iPhone without any problems.  What I didn't notice at the time was that a couple of grains of sand got into the case.  The phone moves just enough inside the case for the sand to get inside and scratch up the back side of my iPhone.This leads me to my next issue.  The rubber outer cover is too tacky.  I believe the sand problem was caused by the tacky rubber not releasing all the sand when I tried brushing it off.  If you keep this phone in your pocket, it will pickup every lint and crud from your pocket.Finally, The plastic film that protects LCD causes an oil slick effect.  There various ways to prevent this from happening (search Google), but Otterbox could have used a different material to prevent this happening in the first place.Good case for protection against major drops & hits.  Not too good against sand...
summary: Watch out for the crud coming in through the sync port

reviewText: This case is simple the best protection you can buy for the iphone.  It fits like a glove, all features and functions of the iphone work seemlessly with the case on, and it protects everything! Some have complained about it making the phone more bulky, but I like the added bulk, it feels more confortable and secure in the hand, and it looks great. Everyone that see's it wants one.Cons: some aftermarket chargers will not fit with the case on.  This was ok for me, as all my chargers worked fine. Would have to be removed from the case to place in a docking station (I don't use one).
summary: Simply the best protection you can buy for iphone.

reviewText: Nothing will hurt my phone in this thing. Dropping it, banging it. It's all good. The clip that came with it wqas a little loose though. I never used it as a belt clip because it would pop off way too easy. I never liked using belt clips anyway, so it wasn't a big deal.

Best iphone case....I had my phone dropped several times but this one protected it.  I tried other cases but they are not tough as this one.  Also, the screen protection is great (makes the screen more responsive than using the actual bare screen).  Must have for iphone owners!
I wrapped my tyke's 3GS hand-me-down with this and it's been fantastic. The phone's survived my kids and it fattens up the handset so it's easy for kids to grip.

I work construction, the Otterbox is a must for those who want to carry their Iphone in the outdoors.This product delivers 100%, I very satisfied with this recommendation by a fellow co-worker.Well put together, great design and has safeguard my investment 110%.Thanks Otterbox

Love all OtterBox products.  The fact that they protect the item you have from falls and water is amazing.  However if you are expecting your phone to be less bulky, don't count on it.  It makes your phone more bulky and that is the price you have to pay for exceptional protection of your phone.  This is perfect for the iPhone because it is known for not being very durable and the screen breaks easily.  Putting on this case is easy, but taking it of is somewhat of a challenge, but again that is the price you have to pay for exceptional protection.

I really like this product.  I feel the my iPhone is well protected in this case.  It looks good when I use my phone.  Only problem, it is too bulky to be able to use an iPhone carrying holster case with it.  The case won't close.

My otterbox came with no instructions, but it was fairly easy to put together.  The otterbox does keep the pone safe.  I even got to test out the protection the Otterbox provides.The belt vlip is completey useless.  After I placed my phone in the belt clip, several minutes later it just "popped" out.  Later I went and sat in the car and before I could shut the door, the Iphone "Popped out"  I dropped my iPhone more times due to the belt clip that I ever have dropped my iPhone(s) since the iPhone came out.  I even placed the ottherbox belt clip w iPhone attached to cup holder in the car and agian it "popped" out.I placed the iPhone in backwards into the otterbox belt clip and was able to keep the iphone engaged with the belt clip in the car as above, but  when standing outside the car, and not moving, the iPhone "popped" out again.Now the case does a great job protecting the iPhone... good thing because the belt clip is really bad.
summary: Good think the case provides good protection....

reviewText: I purchased my case in April 2009 and was very excited to receive it. It installed fairy easily and I had installed an Apple screen protector directly on the phone before installing the case to cure the oily film problem. That fix works great and gives you an additional layer of protection. The problem I had with the case was the echo. Callers started to complain that they heard themselves talking back in their phone. I dismissed it the first couple times I was told about the echo. Blamed it on the wonderful AT&T service. However the complaints kept coming in and it got to the point callers were hanging up on me. I Googled iPhone echo and returned some results about dust & dirt in the microphone and even called Apple & AT&T, neither were helpful. I never suspected the case until I removed the case and swapped out a thinner leather case while on a trip. Much to my surprise, no more complaints. As a test, I had a friend call me from 50 feet away, once with no case & no echo, then with the OtterBox and sure enough an echo. Now the case sits in my desk drawer.

Have an iPhone? want to keep it in one piece? BUY THIS!! As a trucker i find myself in rugged conditions every day. I have dropped my phone on asphalt, concrete, and metal surfaces. the case might get a scratch or a lil dirty... but that phone looks as shiny as it did the day i bought it!Convenient belt-clip makes for carrying it easy and nice. The added protection allows me to have piece-of-mind. And the added 'bulk' makes it easier to hold and use. I cannot say enough about this case. If you want to protect your phone... Invest in this case. Seriously.It does have 1 downfall however. the built in "screen protector" seems to get an 'oil slick' effect, or air bubble or two. this is due to a semi-adhesive texture on it from the mfg process. OtterBox recommends you use powder and compressed air to reduce or completely remove this problem (before putting it on your phone of course). Check out [...] for full instructions.I had to repeat this process about 5 or 6 times before i fixed the problem.... but remember this thing will keep your phone protected in even the toughest "everyday" hazards you will find.[...] has "success" stories, or as I call them "horror stories" one of which includes a guy whose phone got caught by the charging wire, outside the car, and was drug along, bouncing off the pavement, for 1 mi at 35mph and the phone it self was undamaged.THIS IS WORTH IT!
summary: Suit of Armor ... for the iPhone!

reviewText: I bought the Defender and dumped it. Everything I liked about the iPhone was gone once it went inside the Defender. The "oil slick effect" on the screen protector was an absolute disaster. The iPhone's screen sensitivity was severely reduced by this case and you can't easily get to the keyboard characters near the edges because of the Defender's bulky construction. You may be able to run over it without destroying your iPhone but you'll never get used to the shortcomings this case presents you with. Take my advice: BUY the COMMUTER case instead!

Protected my iPhone once it already had a crack in the back from a lesser case.  Lasted a full three years.  The one thing I hate: it was forever pulling my hair whenever I would take the phone down away from my ear.
summary: Great case with a case of the hair-pulls!

reviewText: The product is well made and offers great protection for your I-Phone.  All of the parts fit together well and all of the phone buttons are accessible.  There are other copy cat products on the market at a lower price, but the material & fit are not as good plus some of the function buttons can't be used.  It's not worth the price difference.  The only downside to the product is that you must use OEM connection cables.  The aftermarket connectors are too big for the access opening.  If youj want to keep your I-Phone safe, this is the case to buy!
THIS COMPANY KNOWS WHAT THEY ARE DOING COMFORT QYUALITY YOU FEEL LIKE YOU ARE IN A THEATER I AM SO HAPPY WITH THIS PURCHASE UNFORTUNATLY I BAUGHT THEM IN A RETAIL STORE IN AN AIRPORT FOR WAY MORE

I will admit up front that I am on my 3rd pair of these iphone-ready headphones -- i love the fit and i think the sound quality is more than acceptable for earbuds, but i've lost two previous pairs to the same flaw -- awfully flimsy jack that is tiny and not properly reinforced. i've finally come up with a solution which was to go get some heat-shrink tubing from radio shack - about 3/4 inch of that shrunk around the jack of the MM 50 iP will (i hope) give me a lot more support. seems to be working so far.if sennheiser would just come out with a model that fixed that one fairly glaring problem, these would be a great value headset. however, the fact that i was willing to rebuy it twice should give you some idea that i still consider it an OK deal.
summary: great value, except for the horribly flimsy jack

reviewText: I really think they did a great job on these headphones, for this price you can't beat the sound clarity, the bass response or even the mic quality.  I have two big problems with these headphones.Firstly is a commentary on headphones in general these days - why does the wire have to be covered in this sticky rubbery plastic?  it makes the cables stick together, to you, to your earlobe, to everything! and makes it hard to untangle, which if you are like me you will be doing several times a day.Secondly if you make any movement at all, the sound travels up the wire and rattles yoru earlobes so if you are walking or god forbid running, you will hear every footstep booming in your ear over the music. You can't wear these running.Bottom line - great headphones, worth the price - but with minor drawbacks.

I'm using these on my Sprint HTC Hero Smartphone.  They are performing as I would expect a Sennheiser product to perform.  For my taste in sound, they are great.  Solid base and crisp trebles.  I'm told the microphone quality is clear with proper volume.
summary: As I expected them to be.

reviewText: I purchased these because I've owned Sennheiser products in the past and I've always been very impressed with what Sennheiser offers.First off these do work as advertised and these do work very well with the iphone. They're a great hands free set and the mic and control button work very well. People will have no trouble hearing what you're saying as the mic works very well. I've yet to talk to anyone who realized I was using a hands free set.I did expect more sound wise from these ear buds. The low end is just so weak! Highs are very good, mids are okay but sadly the low is just not present. I've experimented with all different size earpads and had no luck.Bottom line, if you listen to acoustic rock, modern rock, classic rock or jazz you'll be pleased with the sound these put out. If you're more into pop and hip hop or classical you'll likely find the low end really lacking. The overall clarity of these buds is very good but for the price of the buds I found the audio performance to be unbalanced. I don't like overwhelming bass but if your ear buds cannot produce any decent low end bass notes then you're really not hearing all of your music.I've yet to hear a better iphone hands free set but I'm still looking.

I've had these for a few months.  I use them with a Blackberry Curve, and with an iPod.  I have a 16 GB card in the Blackberry which I use when I travel, the iPod for longer flights.  I was in the Music business in recording studio's in the past.  These are the flattest response of all the earbuds I have, and I've tried quite a few in this price range.  The mic is a convenience when using with the Blackberry, I don't have to fuss when the phone rings.  I also have a pair of Philips noise canceling buds, similar price.  The Sennheiser don't give as much isolation as the Philips, but sound better.  The response is very well balanced without the bloated bass or distant mids of many others.  The high end is fairly extended and not harsh.  Some more expensive buds definitely sound better, but I don't like spending more on something I'll lose or break.  These have held up well, sound good and work with iPhones and Blackberries.  What more can you ask for the price?
summary: Can't beat them for the price

reviewText: Sennheiser used to be reputable; now I must agree with those who say these earbuds are junk.  The shorter earbud worked intermittently at first (plugging and unplugging sometimes cleared the problem) and I like the asymmetric form so much that I kept hoping they would 'break in'.  Instead, they just broke, with the shorter earbud not working at all.  Too bad, back to the kludge-but-robust Sure adapter with old Sony earbuds.

First things first, make sure you are ordering the right headset.  These fit a 3.5 mm jack, NOT the old 2.5 mm that you would find in most other/older phones.  Easy way to test if you're not sure, take an iPod headset (or any headset you use for a mp3 or CD player), and see if it fits.  If it does, than you are looking at the right headset.Before getting into too much detail let me first give a concise Pro/Con summation:Pro:Best earbuds on any headphones I've ever used.Con:The microphone is as equally bad as the earbuds are good.Despite being slightly shocked by just how good the earbuds were, these are of no use to me if the microphone is unusable.The Sennheiser MM50 iP Earbuds / Headset have the most outstanding sound I've ever hear from a headset, but an incredibly BAD microphone.  Also, the Sennheisers were engineered to keep the microphone close to your mouth by placing it at the Y of the headphone split, and making on line short enough to pull the mic close to your mouth.  This is an awful design that should never be repeated.  I found myself constantly having to repeat myself when talking on this headset.I can say though, that with the Sennheiser Earbuds, I could hear details in my music that I never heard before.  A simply amazing sound, with outstanding isolation capabilities.  In a very noisy gym, I could keep my iPhone at a low volume and still hear great detail to my music.In comparison, the Ultimate Ears MetroFi headset keeps the normal, symmetrical Y shape to the earbuds, and places the microphone on one of the lines, close to your mouth.  Having my wife call me on her Chocolate 3 phone, I was at first disappointed. "Did you forget to bring the headset with you?" I asked.  Nope, she had them on.Over the years, between the two of us, we've probably used about a dozen different headsets between the two of us, and the MetroFi set was the clear winner when it came to microphone quality.  Funny thing is, to look at them, you wouldn't think it.For earbud quality test, I compared them to my Sony, J2, Metrofi 170vi, and iPod earbuds (all noise isolating except the iPod).  Sound quality places the MetroFi 170vi down by the iPod headset, and sadly, they were probably equal to the iPod headset for noise isolation as well.  The Sony and J2 earbuds were roughly equal in both categories, far behind the Sennheiser, and slightly less far ahead of the MetroFi 170vi and iPod set.Comfort wise, I would rate the four as follows: Sennheiser (again, by far), MetroFi 170vi, Sony, then J2 (So bad, they caused one of my ears to be sore for days)Durability could probably be a little better, but they haven't failed me yet.  So far, just one of the 1 1/2 inch sleaves, attached to the earbuds has come off.I would recommend the Metrofi 170vi set over these.  IMHO, when wearing headphones that are also a headset, microphone quality trumps headset quality.edit 11/28/2010I earbud died shortly after this review. It kills me, 'cause for comfort and sound quality, nothing beats these... nothing even comes close to these. Unfortunately, a crappy mic, and poor durability make this a lousy product.
summary: Incredible earbuds don't make up for poor microphone

reviewText: These sound a lot better than the Apple In-Ear earphones with remote and mic. They have more bass and sound pretty good for the price. They work with the iPhone as they have a mic and button but no volume controls unfortunately.That's where the praise ends though. The mic housing is a bit heavier than I would like and I don't like how the right cable is made to go behind your neck. Also, no case is included. Also talking on the phone with these is not comfortable at all because of the seal they make in your ears, you can't hear yourself talk! You therefor have to pull out the earbuds a bit when talking on the phone.While these do sound pretty good for music, I regret my purchase and wish I had just bought some better audiophile earbuds without the mic instead.
summary: Better sound than stock earbuds but not without negatives

reviewText: Exactly the kind of dock I was looking for.  Fits the Note 3 and a wireless charger inside the grip.  Best and least expensive solution to a qi wireless car dock.

Bought this to fix it to my Honda Civic dashboard. Front Window is too far at the end. It doesn't fixed as I liked on the dashboard. I am using it at the front window close to the mirror. Not so good but useful. Provider sent it without any problems.
summary: Don't fix as I liked to the dashboard

reviewText: It's an unobtrusive stand, which is easily adjustable and does the job. However, the ball joint is not rock solid, so my phone tends to shake a lot if the road surface is anything other than silky smooth. Still, this thing is very inexpensive, so I'm not complaining.
It holds well I love it great for the price the hardest thing was placement it's great on glass but not great on plastic

I just received my BoxWave TinyMount.  I can tell from the build that this mount is much better than the ones I've tried from Fry's or BestBuy.  So the first thing I noticed is that the suction cup seems super flat, there is a lock mount that you twist when you place the mount on a flat surface (like the windshield or on the included flat coaster adapter).  I did not have a need to use the coaster as I already have a flat surface to use the TinyMount, at first it did not seem like it would stick, but I simply added a few drops of water to the suction cup, and attempted to attach the mount and it has been solid.  I drive a truck, and even on bumpy roads this unit holds without issue.  I like how easy it is to mount my iPhone and how well it holds a grip.if anything changes I will come back to update my review, but at the moment it's fantastic, and exactly what I was looking for.  This mount is so easy to adjust angles so it faces you easily.EDIT -- 1/29/14So the mount broke in almost 1 month from owning it.  I contacted the seller via amazon and they sent me a label to mail them back the broken mount and they refunded me my money.How did it break?  It was a very hot weekend, on Monday I got into the car and I went to try and pull the arms apart to fit my phone and the tiny neck leading to the base broke with almost no effort.  I did get my Money back, and maybe this mount requires you to remove it from your car on a hot day.--Since then I bought new car mount from a local chain store, from manufacturer: ADURO, (u-touch) renamed to u-grip now.  but what I like is that I've owned the new mount for over a month and it's been really positive.  it is not compact like the boxwave, but it has a feature: side buttons that effortlessly expand the arms that hold your phone so you can remove it quickly and easily.  you can drop your phone into place there is a button that holds your phone into place nicely.  I think if boxwave adds something like this I may buy another product, especially since they were so nice to refund my money when I had a product that did not survive.
summary: Sleek, Small Mount, could be great.

reviewText: No frills but it works.  I have since taken to using a different mount that doesn't require clipping the phone in.
It works great after you glue or velcro it to the dashboard.  I did not expect to have that problem.  next?
Feels like cheaper plastic, and I feel hard to insert iPhone 5. Had to use both hands every time. Expected much better quality. Won't recommend.
Made of cheap plastic but will do the job.  I don't think it will hold up for the long haul, so if you looking for something temporary...then go for it.  It's cheap but functional.
summary: Ok but hey what do you expect for the price

reviewText: This may be OK but it will certainly NOT work with my Samsung Galaxy Note 2. It's pretty much designed for narrow width/height phones like the iPhone.
This is the best cellphone mount I ever bought! it works amazingly well and its tiny size and low price makes it even better!

This item is the most practical item I have ever gotten! Small and versatil. can be placed on windshield or Dashboard - can be rotated in any direction you'd like. The "grab" is perfect in the sense that it grabs the phone so that it does not obstruct any functions of the device and does not press any buttons. Also the "grab" adjusts on its own according to the width of the phone itself.Simply PERFECT!

Brilliant design, fits anywhere, so much less than other mounts which cost twice or more, and do the very same thing.Lack of instructions might confuse. I believe another review explains how the thing works, but here's the way I went about application. The mount resembles an old waffle press: there's a base and upper plate attached by a hinged arm. When mounted, the upper piece (which holds your phone) swings up, or down to customize your ideal view.The entire base is essentially a "ribbed knob", just above the suction cup. Turn the knob (which has nice ratcheting feel) "all the way to the LEFT" (counter-clockwise) to prepare for mounting.Now find that sweet-spot for your phone. Play with various locations. You'll find it's flexibility remarkable. Once you've found that sweet spot, press the suction cup FIRMLY against the surface...while...AT SAME TIME, turning that "ribbed knob" (you turned left before), firmly to the RIGHT - all the way - until the suction cup is firmly locked in place. That's it! Turning the knob pushes down on the suction-cup, forcing air out, and locking mount in place.The mount is so flexible is design, it really can mount almost anywhere, and the spring-loaded arms open wide...enough to hold my Samsung Note2 firmly in place.The only frustration I found is the moveable arm will be "slightly" pull from a dead-on straight view...simply by the phone's weight. But playing with angles & locations will almost assure a spot you'll be happy with.Company very wisely included a plate to replace the suction cup which has a very strong adhesive on back. This allows placement virtually anywhere you want.Compact, solid, and does the job fore a small investment (right here on Amazon).

I needed something for occasional use ( rental cars and such) to hold my iPhone in place. This does this well. Since it sits unused in my glovebox most of the time, I am concerned that somehow the suction surface will get damaged. I like the way it adjusts for different angled windshields. One thing I don't like is how far out of reach things on the windshield are, but that would be true for any windshield mount.  It isn't real sturdy and might not be good for everyday use

This is the second one that I have purchased. The first one went in my car.  My wife who normally likes no gadgets in the windshield just loved my iphone there.  She saw me using GPS DRIVE, the gps application and instantly learned that it is so much better than the build in navigation system from the factory in her car.  So she demanded I buy this iphone holder for her car.  Came in yesterday and it is already in her car.  Thinking I should buy one more for travel.  Probably will.
summary: Does exactly what you want it to do, and it costs less

reviewText: My main purpose for getting this mount was to use NaviGone Navigation software on my iPhone, and I'm happy to report, this device has provided the perfect solution.When it arrived, and like others, I too thought it felt a little cheap.  Then you open it up and feel how dense the plastic is and realize this is a well made piece of equipment.The suction cup isn't a "lick and stick" like some, or like the kind you'd use for a radar detector.  This is the real deal with a compression clamp.  Hold it up to the windshield, push the clamp, and this thing isn't letting go of your windshield any time soon.I can rotate and the extension arm vertically or horizontally with ease while driving.  I love this device so much, that I just use it to hold my phone even when playing music.Finally, yes it holds your phone VERY tightly.  Tightly enough that you have to use a good amount of force to push it into the holder and then to get it out.  Frankly, since it's holding my $300 phone and who knows how much in apps, I'm kind of glad it does.
summary: Solid as a rock.  Even on the worst of roads.

reviewText: I use this for holding my Iphone when in the car.  It works great.  No problem with sticking to the wind shield.  It has never fallen off.It's good for the gps on the phone, the iPod feature, and using the phone with a speaker.Works well on my new Iphone4 as well.  No complaints on this one.

I have this mount and have used it a few times and will say that it does a good job at holding the iphone 3G. The extension arm is very short but that does mean it doesn't have a lot of movement like other brands have. It's a solid product.My only real issue is that it's a little difficult to get the phone in and out of the mount. If you have any type of a case this will not work for you. I now use an otterbox case and there is no way it will work with this mount, and to be fair it doesn't say that it will.This mount is a great mount only if you have an iphone 3G or ipod touch and don't have any type of protection on it. If you do you will want to look for another option.
summary: One of the better options I have seen as long as you don't have a case.

reviewText: This product works well holding the I-phone in place. I was hoping to use an FM transmitter with it but the transmitter wont fit into the phone because the flanges that hold it in place come around too far.Still, the product does what it says it will do and that is securely hold your i-phone while you are travelling.

I've used it on two week-long business trips and it has stayed in placed perfectly. I usually remove it on hot sunny days, and haven't had any problems getting it to re-attach. It holds the phone securely and has plenty of adjustment. The cradle comes apart creating two pieces so it fits easily in my luggage. Other models are out there that include a dock connector so you can leave your power and aux cables attached and just remove the phone, but cost more I'm sure. I don't mind attaching those manually each time; small inconvenience that trades off in size and weight for travel. Great product especially considering the price.

This is nice. the charger that came with my ipod sort of broke so I had to purchase a new one and this was a nice replacement.

This charges my iphone 4 slower than other chargers I've purchased, but it's fine for a nightstand charger that is plugged in overnight.  Also, if you plug it into an iPad (1st gen) the iPad says "not charging", but it really is charging, just very very slowly.

This charger has worked fine for as many months as I have owned it.  I left it plugged into the outlet and used it daily to charge my Iphone while at work.  Charged quickly and without fail.  No errors on Iphone when using this charger.

reviewText: Jabra's EXTREME Bluetooth headset turns out to be a solid product and it has what it takes to, possibly, stand out in the crowded and fiercely competitive field of Bluetooth headsets. I will start by discussing the features that appeal to me the most with the most important at the top of the list:- Extremely light weight - quite impressively so, especially coming from a company known for making those 'office' half-foot long boom microphones sticking out of one's ears. I had the EXTREME in my ear for more than an hour at a time and I could hardly feel it.- Can stay connected to 2 devices simultaneously - most helpful because when working I use both my 'regular' phone and MS Communicator (company standard) running on my laptop so, after pairing them both to the EXTREME, it's a lot easier for me to communicate.- Can pair with up to 8 devices - nice, but I have no idea what happens when you try to pair the 9th. I have mine paired to 5 at this time and all is well. If I ever go beyond 8 and live, I will come back to this review and update it with my experience.- Many charging options - the headset's Micro-B socket can get power from the supplied AC-to-USB adapter (cord is only 1 ft. long), through the car-to-USB adapter, from one of your own computer's powered USB slots or from anything that comes with a Micro-B plug such as some other headset's charger.- Multiple wear styles - you get 2 'behind the ear' hooks (large and small), 2 'inside ear' hooks attached to their own gels. There's no problem to use it in either right or left ear.- Good in and out sound quality. I tested it with friends and co-workers who either didn't notice a difference between this set and the device I used before or, in a couple of occasions, volunteered to tell me that the connection was a lot clearer than in used to be.- Controls as ergonomically placed as possible on such a small headset. Both the answer/end and the 2 volume (+-) buttons are easy to reach. The on/off switch is not but you don't need and in fact you don't want to touch that while wearing the set. You can redial by double-tapping answer/end, you answer by tapping it once and you may reject the call by keeping it pressed for 2-3 seconds. Voice dialing (not one of my favorite options when in office) is also supported.- Nice presentation - the headset comes inside an nice clear plastic case that makes it really stand out and look like some modern art museum display and could be a storage option when not in use.- Excellent customer support. Again, a surprise. I was talking to a real human person within a couple of minutes of calling Jabra's support line when I thought I had a problem with either charging or pairing (false alarm, my fault). The support technician helped me to quickly solve the problem and, while at that, told me that I could send my defective unit back for a replacement if the product turned out to be defective, which it wasn't.- 1 year limited warranty - whatever.
