summary: Very nice case for a low price

reviewText: this case looks great but doesnt really offer anything in ways of protection. i dropped it and my phone poppped out of the case causing minor scratches on the sides. i know having the sides exposed doesnt protect it much anyways but i didnt expect it to fall out of its case so easily.
I purchased this 2 mos. ago..works great.good quality, protects my ipod and have easy access to all functions. priced so low for a quality product

I love this case.  It's padded to protect your Ipod, it looks great and it's a great value (I love saving money).  In the 4 months since I bought it, it has saved my Ipod touch from disaster several times when I dropped it.  I saw where one reviewer stated that you can't access the volume rocker button when the touch is in the case, but unless they bought a different product other than the one on this page, that is simply not true.  The front left side of the case is lower than the right to allow access to the volume control when the case is closed.  You can also charge the Ipod while in the case, in fact, I never remove it from the case.  In this case, for once, I got more than I paid for.

This is my second case for my Galaxy Note 2 and bang this one hits the nail on the head. The protective bumpers on the corners stick out just enough to deter any corner damage. The case is a slim fit, being as tho i am 6' 8" it fits in my jeans pocket with no problem. It has a padded front cover which is especially nice. Also around the edges you can still see the chrome accents best case so far. I would definitely recommend this case to anyone.
summary: Fits how you want a case to fit

reviewText: This cover fit my Ipod Touch perfectly.  The openings in the bottom and top are placed perfectly.  It really protects it, also.

I originally purchased a leather case from this same manufacturer but it opened from the side instead of the top and I didn't like that at all, so I decided to give this one a try. This case is great! It provides great protection, access to the ports, and looks good doing so. You really can't go wrong for the price.
The leather holster if precisely the size needed for my new Samsung Galaxy Note II smart phone.  It arrived quickly and was exactly as advertized.  The price was excellent as was the service

I wanted a nice case for my Note 2, in particular one the had a flip cover and was not just a plastic wraparound. Probably a plastic case the wraps around the whole phone would protect it better. But this case looks really nice on the phone. I like the flip cover because it provides protection for the screen while in my pocket. The case is thin and light and comfortable to use. The Flip cover closes with a flap that fits perfectly and the closure is tight. The sides are pretty open, I like the way it looks but its is susceptible to damage there if it falls on something. The clasps that hold the phone in place protect the corners but the sides are left to the elements. The opening for the lenses, pen speaker  and plugs are in the perfect place and do not interfere in any way. If you want this sort of case and with the understanding that other cases may protect the phone better, I would recommend this case.
summary: Good case for te Galaxy Note 2

reviewText: It is as good as the other reviewers say.  Soft leather on the outside and microfiber trim to hold the iPod Touch inside.  There is a magnetic snap for closure.  All of the buttons are accessible without taking the iPod Touch out of the case.  Great protection with the hard flap over the screen.  I highly recommend this product.
summary: Great product at a great price!

reviewText: got this case for my mom. does what it needs to do i.e. cover and protect phone. the faux leather has a nice feel. not bad for the price

This PU case seems fairly protective for the Note 3 as long as it's closed.  It's also easy to put on and take off, and gives good access to the buttons on the Note 3.  One noise canceling microphone port is missing on the corner, which I was able to drill out.
This is a great product that protects my iPod touch. It is easy to use with the iPod and provides versatility to the device.

Case looks professional and looks great! This case is sturdy, well-made, and fits my iPod Touch 3G perfectly. It has done a great job protecting my Touch for the past year and a half from scratches and drops.  Highly recommend this product for its quality and its price.

Solid structure. Synthetic leather exterior is nice quality. Stitches are accurate. Dimensions are correct and case fit device well. Since it is a flip case, the cover is dangling next to the face while making calls but it do not find disturbing or annoying. It is not designed for being used as “stand” to watch movies on device, but flipping cover under some angle will allow unit stay on the side without falling.

This cover offered great quality for low price exactly as billed. Unlike other reviewers, I did not find it to be too big to securely hold the i-pod.  Also the opening at the bottom was large enough to allow for easy connection to external devices.

I was inspired to try this case after receiving its sibling,Evecase Leather Wallet Case with Stand and Credit Card Holder for Samsung Galaxy Note 2 II N7100 - Black.Like that case, this one was obviously designed by someone who knew what they were doing because it provides solid protection and fits the phone like a glove. The construction is also first-rate.While I was pleased with the first model I ordered, I was curious about whether I would be happier with this flip open model. The truth is I prefer the other one, but people are different and it comes down to personal preference.What I love about this (and the other one from the same company), aside from the design and construction, is the fact that you do not replace the back cover of your phone with a part of a case like with other Galaxy Note 2 cases on the market. Another factor is value, which to me is what you get for the price. With this case or its sibling you get something to protect your expensive Note 2 at a very low price. And when you add in the attention paid to design and construction then the value becomes significant.Check out both models to find the case style that suits you. I personally think that you cannot go wrong with either of them - and that is after investing a lot of time researching the other cases on the market.
summary: A winner in design, construction and functionality

reviewText: Do yourself a favor and look somewhere else for a case for your Zune Hd. This case is NOT real leather as advertised and it's suppose to have a magnetic closing device on it and it does NOT so the case never closes. I emailed the seller and they promptly refunded my money.

As the new HTC One had so few alternatives for a proper case, I ordered one from Hong Kong and I decided on getting the Evercase to protect my phone while the case from Asia arrived.  Well, I received the Evercase today and its nice, has the proper slots in the rear for the camera and microphone and fits the phone properly.Nevertheless, is not the type of case I usually have as missing the belt clip.  Another thing it lacks is slots for the front speakers which other cases have.  But for less than $10.00 with shipping, I highly recommend this case.  Seems to be the most proper vertical flip alternative for those of us who do not like Hard cases or horizontal opening ones.  Photos have been included.
Basic case. Doesnt provide much protection. I would suggest spending the extra money and getting a sturider case. Doesnt do much other than provide fashion.

the material feels good in my hand. it fits the phone perfectly.  all side holes/buttons/toggles are properly aligned to access.  the top cover part will fold all the way around the phone so you can set it on your desk without having the cover in the way. even with this cover on and folded back,  I can still mount (barely) the phone on an older phone mount with suction cup in my car with the cover flap folded around to the back.  I broke the phone a week earlier, so buying this was closing the barn door after the horses left, but it appears it could protect the phone from a drop from your waist.  I'll give it 5 stars, but I can't really say "I love it" ... I'd rather not have a cover on my phone, but if I must, this one does the trick.

I've looked at this case many times over the past couple of years, bought another, and then finally after buying one for my husband, immediately ordered another one for myself.  My husband was looking for a case that protected the screen a little better than the plastic screen protectors because he wanted to carry it to work.  The silicone ones we had were a little bulky.  I wish I would have purchased this case when I first looked at them.  The cover is a nice quality, soft leather that just feels good in your hand.  It fits the iTouch 2nd generation perfectly and is a simple design.  On top of all that the price is very attractive for a leather case, even with the shipping.The USB port and earphone jack are exposed when the case is open or closed and it's a nice, slim case that fits easily in your pocket or briefcase.  Two thumbs up for this case.

I was very pleased with this product.  It is a nice case, fits well and it is easy to insert and remove my iPod Touch.  I also thought the vendor did an excellent job packing and shipping the case almost immediately.
Its made of leather (I can't tell if it is real or not), stitched well, and is slightly padded. The magnet clasp is great. Also, it isn't that bulky. AWESOME CASE

As others have noted this offers great protection of the Touch and Phone.  I use it for my Touch (with an iKross Screen Protector.  I have no fear of coins or toher materials that could damage Touch.  And the price is a steal.

Nice little case, but the iPod didn't fit squarely in the unit I got. Otherwise, it'll do for protection, but doesn't look nearly as nice in use as some other products. I am afraid the upper screen bezel protection will not last too long - it's a bit thin.
summary: Don't expect miracles - you get what you paid for.

reviewText: The newer Voyager Pro is much, much better but this was a good bluetooth device in it's day.  Not as tough as I would have liked though.
summary: Good bluetooth not as good as the newer version

reviewText: Except for couple scuffs on the writings....there is absolutely NO difference in the quality and performance of this high end bluetooth unit! Have used a 'comparable class Jabra' which unfortunately died on me only after couple months of usage: There is no doubt these 2 competitors are the absolute BEST in the business:This Voyager 510 is Solid, Aesthetically excellent and performs Flawlessly: Big bang for the bucks to pick this up at more than half the retail price for a refurb!
summary: Excellent Product & Superior Quality for a Refurb!!

reviewText: I used this only for a few months. It was alright....did the job....very funky looking though....not a bad price though.

This product works great. I have the new iPhone and connecting it and making my first call took less then 20 seconds. I was at my Bluetooth pairing screen, turned on the earpiece while I was going to look at how to pair it up. When it did. Made my first call a few seconds after that. The sound is clear and everyone says that I sound fine. No echos, no distance. The earpiece fits comfortable and after wearing it for an entires day driving it didn't hurt or irritate my ear. The extra bonus was it wouldn't pair with my father-in-law's iPhone. He spent days trying to get mine to work with his to try it out and it wouldn't work. Thy was a great bonus. His phone was broken and wouldn't pair with it. It wasn't the earpiece's fault.
summary: Works as directed and with a little bonus.

reviewText: I've been using my Plantronics Voyager 510 Recertified Bluetooth Headset for just over a week now with my Sony Ericsson Z750a.I hear every one I call perfectly. The people on the other end have complained of hearing noise that sounds like wind or hearing a clicking that sounds like I'm driving over train tracks or a bridge - both when I'm indoors, in room with no windows.A couple of times either the headset or the phone has lost its connection with the other as I'm placing a call. But once I disconnect the call, they link back up and work fine.This is the first headset I've had that doesn't fall off my little ears. I use the smallest earpiece of the three it came with and it works really well for me. I can wear the Voyager 510 for 45 minutes or so before my ear starts feeling annoyed with it. Thankfully it easily changes to fit the other ear.So far the talk time and stand-by time have been really good. I've talked for a few hours without having to recharge it.The answer/disconnect and volume buttons are placed well and work easily. The power button makes me ask, "What were they thinking?"Now, if they'd just make a charger for it for my car, where I use it most, I'd be more likely to rate this a 5-star product.

I saved the money and bought the factory re-certified. It works flawlessly. Two most important features for me are the fit and the ability to connect to two phones simultaneously.  The fit is worth the price. Weight is behind the ear and it doesn't feel like it will fall off when moving around.  I can wear it for hours comfortably. I have a personal cell phone and a Blackberry and it connects to both.  All for $30.

I've just had to replace the Plantronics 510 Voyager that I've had for over 2 years because I twisted it incorrectly when trying to adapt it for use on my right ear instead of my left and that errant twist apparently broke a wire inside renedering it useless. This was my error and not an indication of the quality of the headset.I am replacing it with the exact same thing as this is the best headset I've had the experience of using. I've had several over the years...jabra, another plantronics. The 510 Voyager has the best audio clarity of them all and people tell me my voice sounds clear and strong. Some people can't believe I'm using my cell-pone.The only thing I don't like about this headset is the on-off button can be difficult to press. It's just a bad design of that particular feature but all things considered, I think this headset is an outstanding bargain considering it's performance.UPDATE: March 4, 2009: Unfortunately I've had to return the "Recertified" Voyager 510 because the battery life was not per specifications or what I was accustomed to with my previous 510. The battery did not hold a charge for very long thus the talk time and standby time was diminished. I've returned the unit and have reordered the "normal" 510 for $10 more.
summary: Excellent sound quality. Decent battery life. A bit clunky

reviewText: There are a lot of bad bluetooth headsets out there. This isn't one of them.  Very good in all respects. I would give it 5 stars if it was a little less bulky, but overall at least 4.5 stars. Controls pretty easy to use by touch, great sound quality & volume in/out, good fit, and long battery life. Also, the charger is easier to plug into the headset than most I've tried. Setup was a snap.
Love my iPhone case it fits perfectly & looks good too. I've gotten lots of compliments. Price was not bad either.

Overall really nice build and fit. The problem I had was I did not expect the black alligator look would be so glossy. Great fit and finish. I would order the blue or black leather if I ordered it again.
summary: Good but not what I expected.

reviewText: I got the purple which I like (kind of a light plum). It's small (just slightly larger than the ipod), with a place for bills and two slots for credit cards/license etc. Very convenient. The magnetic strip works perfectly--and the strap and lens/flash are perfectly placed. My only quibble is that so far the stand doesn't work very well. It's...okay...but probably needs to be used/pushed into place more so it rests down and stable. Not a big thing though--this is cute, convenient, gives lots of protection and I liked it much more, for my needs, than any hard or vinyl cases I've seen.
summary: Thin, Useful, I like the color

reviewText: I've tried other wallet cases and none can hold a note to this one. Other cases are made mostly of a vinyl while this is a faux leather. I found its durability is far greater. The button snap is a huge advantage vs a magnetic flap.
I wanted something to protect my ipod touch and this works best for me, it is easy to use and has a magnetic closure. It was definitely worth the money.
This did case did not hold up very well. Although it's really cute, it got dirty and fell apart rather quickly. If I could do it over, I would've invested in a different case.
summary: Save your money, buy a different case.

reviewText: Great fit, very useful card slots, easy to carry all you need to run out the door, great gift for my wife.
summary: Easy to carry all you need to run out the door

reviewText: i loved my phone case but it is now april and now its falling apart because i really do use the wallet on my phone more than my actuall walllet i wish it would have lasted a little longer
I ordered this product for a friend. they have an Iphone 5 and liked the way it looked. they dont have an account.
I had one that was magnetic closure, this is a snap, wish I had known that, its is flimsy and not up to my standards
High quality, fits like a glove and works nice.  Will definitely be my travel option! 5 starts because there were no disappointments.

I started using the Parrot systems back in 2009 (MKi9200); since than, I fitted two more Parrots (MKi9100).The 9100 does not allow you to insert an SD card as the 9200 does and does not feature a color display, but that's all as far as differences. I opted for the 9100 because of the shape of the display, allowing a better integration and because of the sleek design.In early '09 I had to fight with less performant firmware, but current versions are absolutely flawless and a lot better than most integrated systems I found on well established European brands.Basically this system has it all: Phone over car stereo, blue tooth playback of audio files from any blue tooth enabled device, USB (used for upgrading firmware, but also for charging devices), obsolete (old) Apple connector (can be upgraded to lightning with an adapter).A scenario I totally love is listening to music from my well located Note 3 phone, streamed from "Spotify", having the navigation screen and if directions are spoken the music is muted and on top of that when a call comes in, that one will have priority over nav and music. As soon as you hang up, the nav/music scenario goes on...Only 4 out of five stars because the display could use a brighter setting besides the "daytime" one. In my convertible roadster I had to move the display to various spots in order to be able to read at open top and direct sunlight.The installation should not take more than one hour if the supplied harness fits your car stereo and about 2 1/2 hours if you need to cut into the car wires. Adapter harnesses for specific car makes are also available, but those will do the same thing as a skilled owner would do by cutting into the car wires.I have not yet seen a factory integrated system which will allow you (as the Parrot does) to listen to music while the navigation is on and on top of that allowing phone calls, but I will agree I haven't seen them all :)
summary: Probably the best after market solution for non-blue tooth fitted vehicles

reviewText: I had this Parrot professionaly installed on my Pioneer AVH-P4100DVD, it works great for making and receiving calls, windows down or up, people hear me great on the other side, noone has complained about hearing noises on the background.It pulls not only my contact list from my iPhone but also the battery charge level on the little screen.  Voice commands work amazingly good.The only complaint I have is that if you turn on the unit (when you turn on your car) with the iPhone already connected to the radio, when the iPhone starts to play music, the Parrot will detect it and WILL swap the music to bluetooth, that means that it will mute the radio, freeze the iPhone music controls on it and transfer both audio and iPhone controls to the Parrot unit.... I hate that.  The only way I get around this is to connect the iPhone to my radio interface AFTER the Parrot has turned on completely and detected and sincronized the iPhone.But, again, the bluetooth connectivity for making and receiving calls, works like a charm.
summary: Works great but with a flaw I could not fix

reviewText: Great product! This is worth the cost.  Not only can you make and accept calls, the system announces the caller for you.  You can also use it to dial by contact name by pressing the green call button.  In addition, it plays music through Bluetooth, USB, iPod/iPhone (30 pin), and 1/8" Aux line.  The remote can be placed anywhere as it is wireless.  I like how the knob turns to select different songs and menu items.  Definitely would recommend a Parrot kit.

Pros: This is greatly convenient and works great for my Droid X, and now my Galaxy Nexus. I use it to stream Pandora/Google Music and make calls. The sound quality is good and people can hear me just fine.Cons: When I first set this up I had a couple issues with it not turning on when the car turned on. Turning the car off, then back on did work but it was inconvenient. I'm not sure what fixed this issue but I did update it and it seems that since then I've not had that issue again.I doesn't seem to allow me to enter text through the parrot microphone for voice text input into Android. Only when using the parrot's voice input specifically for calling.As of now if someone calls me (only with the Galaxy Nexus) and I go to answer the call through the parrot it locks the device up and it reboots. If I call them, there are no issues whatsoever. I hope this is updated sometime soon, because I assume it is a new ICS Android 4.0 issue.

We were tired with using a battery operated visor speaker.  The quality was just ok and it needed to be recharged about once a week which quickly became a pain to the point of it collecting dust.  Well, after local law enforcement "reminded" us about cell phone use, it was time to find another solution.This thing is great!  It's hard wired to the car and works very well.  Audio comes out of your car's speakers and the system automatically mutes music during an incoming call.  The mic also picks up very well, including passengers in the back seat.I was surprised at the iPod sound quality.  It sounded better than the aux input on our factory radio.  This is due to the unit having it's own amp which bypasses your radio's amp.  In the case of stock, it's better.  However if you have an aftermarket system, it may sound worse.Pros:1) Mic quality2) Sound quality3) Automatically mutes music4) iPod music sounds even better over a stock system.5) Steering remote works very well.6) Easier installation when using a car specific wiring harness (all plug n play).  In the case of our 2008 Honda Civic we needed a BT-1722-A adapter.  Amazon's recommendation was for the BT-1721-A adapter which is incorrectCons:1) Install may be difficult for some.  If you ever replaced a car radio, this'll be easy, especially with the harness.2) Screen could be brighter in direct sunlight.Note:- Unit came with software version 1.91 as indicated in the advanced settings menu and the white sticker on the blue brainbox.  You can download the latest software to a USB drive from Parrot's website.  Version 1.91 didn't seem to work with an iPad 2 as a music player.  Version 2.02 was available for download which corrected this problem.- For about the same price, you could purchase a new car stereo with built in iPod and BT, Pandora support and a better integrated amplifier than your stock radio.  You already have to remove the stereo to add this product therefore you might as well upgrade to a new headunit.  For example, the JVC KD-R730BT is cheaper than this product and offers much more features.  In our case, we went with Parrot because our Civic has navigation.- The plug n play harness was actually cheaper on _Crutchfield and they included step by step instructions for removing our radio at no extra charge.
summary: Better than Visor Mounted BT Speaker

reviewText: This thing is re-donk-u-lous. It has perfect bluetooth for calls,Super Easy to hook up (if you get the harness. Parrot recommends a place on thier site.), Sounds good, and easy to use. I bought this after seeing it on a tv car show. At thetime I was looking at buying a Navigation head unit for my truck that had blue tooth and iphone controls. I took a chance on this and i am very happy. Why? Because when you stream BT audio you can use your appsPandora, Slacker, etc. But another thing you can use is your navigation apps and the nav will run in the background meaning that you can listed to music and when instructions come it lower the music tells you then turns it back up. This thing does everythig I wanted a $1000 radio to do. Only bad thing is that now I think my wife wants one. And who do you think is going to have to buy it???
summary: Dude, Stop thinking and BUY IT!!!

reviewText: I did not buy it from amazon, but another site which gave me a harness to plug and play this unit.Installation with the help of a friend took an hr, because of how we routed the wires.At times, it has trouble connecting to my Galaxy Nexus because if I start my car using my remote starter, it sometimes doesn't see my device so I have to go into the menus and manually say connect to bluetooth audio.This is annoying at times but that's all.  The addition of the ipod and usb drive options are good.What I wish the software would do is when you connect a usb drive, instead of having every artist listed, an alphabet can appear first and then you can select the artist.Every time I start my car, if I want to listen to an artist that starts with the letter N for instance, I have to scroll all the way to that artist starting from A.If playlists or if it had internal memory to remember your last song played was available in this model it would be perfect. I would then buy a 64gb usb drive and use that as my storage instead of streaming from google play during my daily commute. Audio is solid for music and a bit muffled for conversations, but it could be my vehicle (2005 Ford Explorer sport trac) that has a loud interior driving noise.If you want a solid bt set that is not in your ear, this is the unit for you.I may even just use this for music and use my plantronics for business calls.LOVE THAT THIS UNIT CUTS OUT YOUR MUSIC AND OR FACTORY RADIO TO TAKE CALLS.I see no reason to get the color screen because this is so low profile it's not in your way.
summary: Have had this for almost a year

reviewText: Parrot MKi9000, MKi9100, and MKi9200 are the same except for the display. 9000 has no display, 9100 has 2-line LED display, and 9200 has color LCD. They all support voice prompt and they work fine without a display, but I recommend the display model even if don't plan on using it after installation. My iPod was not playing through Parrot, and it turned out to the non-supported model and the only way I found out was with a display unit; the voice-only mode will not show this problem.I also purchased a wiring harness to use on 2012 Toyota Tacoma truck. Although it was relatively expensive, the time saved was well worth it.
Works awesome, love it..never have any problems.id buy this product 200000xs more if i had too...product never glitched on me or anything.
The spring in the unit pushes the two way out of the 12v socket.  I contacted the seller and got no repsonse.Update, it partially melted last time I used it.  Fire hazard?  Possibly.
Ive seen this for well triple the price here. It arrived several days early. It works great. No problems at all.

This is a good product. It is exactly what I needed, I am a truck driver and some of the trucks only have one outlet, I have a gps and use my phone for traffic app so I needed two outlets. This works great, altho sometimes it shakes out of the outlet so you have to keep and eye on it. If you're in a car it may not shake out, but a great product and well worth the money

Was looking for a device to help with vehicles, especially rental ones, that do not have an abundance of outlets for all the electronic "toys" that we have.  This is okay, but there are others available that have USB ports as well.  They are great.

This is perfect for a long trip. Both sockets work, although a little more slowly because it is splitting the power between two things. I usually have an iPhone charger in 1 and a radar detector in the other.
Works, nothing special, but good value for the money. The perk is the light so you know you are actually charging.  I still have and use, good price, feels cheap, but works.

They're cheap, but work. I've ordered a few since they just break in one way or another. Since purchasing my last one I've invested in a more durable and reliable device. The reliability and durability of this one is not guaranteed.

this item does the trick but is fairly large. it can appear relatively tacky but i have gotten used to it. i used to use it to power my gps and my radar detector simultaneously. i moved to an area where radar detectors are not permitted so i rarely use it these days.
So it is now in the closet  maybe to be sold at a yard sale one day. bad purchase decision on my part, Great concept just doesn't work with older vehicles
summary: ummmm  blows fuzes when i use it

reviewText: I bought this so I wouldnt have to unplug my radar detector when I need to charge my cell. It fits perfectly in the small spot, only thing I noticed it's a little loose, not a completey tight fit. But it works for what I need.

I was really excited about this! I wanted to be able to charge my phone and use my radar detector simultaneously, it worked great for almost a month and then all of the sudden it stopped. Nothing is broken or out of place that I can see and I never moved it but it definitely does not work anymore. I did get a refund and the sellers were very polite but the fact remains the same... It does not work forever
With so many things needing to be plugged into electrical connections in the car, if you only have the cigarette lighter connection this is a great way to multiply your connections.
summary: Needed more outlets in the car

reviewText: I live in a home with a lot of brick. My husband, using Belkin products, has found a way to get the internet working wirelessly around the house but for some reason, the basement is just off limits. It's been my office for a while now, and I've been going without access. I didn't want to run a wire with two dogs and three toddlers running around. I've used things in the past like this to get a decent internet reception in my basement, and the signal won't even register. So I was more than prepared to right this off as another product that would do nothing, but I was very wrong. It was easy to hook up, plug it in and go. It came with a mount that i placed as far up the staircase as possible and as soon as I turned on my computer I was shocked to have a "good" signal reading. Just to make sure it wasn't a fluke, I turned off the booster and again, nothing; plugged it back and I was still getting a "good" reading. I worked for hours tonight and there wasn't even a dip in the signal strength.

Wilson Electronics MobilePro Cell Phone Signal Booster for Car and Home / Office w/4" Magnet Mount Antenna ' For Multiple UsersThe Wilson Mobile Pro works great. It improved my cell reception in a rural mountain area with a hardly any reception for about 20 miles. Cut the lack of use down from about 20 miles to only about 2 miles that has no reception. Works best as mobile. Also tried at home and it works but very spotty inside.

I was researching ways to boost cell signals when I found this. After reading many reviews I realized that the issue of weak cell signals can be fixed, easily and permanently, with a cell phone that can use WIFI to make receive calls text and data. A weak cell signal is a common problem with concrete and metal buildings shielding those signals out. But we always have access to WIFI at home or in the office. Republic Wireless solved this problem over two years ago. It uses VOIP calling backed up by both Sprint Cell and Verizon roaming. It also works world wide on WIFI for $5 a month. Service is unlimited and has no contract. An unlimited call and text plan is $10 a month, and unlimited cell, text and data is $25 a month. You do have to use their phone (Moto X $299 or Moto G $149) because they need Republic's proprietary software to work at these rates. I have been using them for over 18 months now and it has worked perfectly.
summary: You may not need this at all.

reviewText: I plugged the unit in and the bars on my phone went from 2 to 5 after a few seconds.  While I am in Central NJ cell phone coverage can be spotty depending on exact location and carrier.  Very impressive device.  I just wish it had a range beyond 2 feet from the booster.
summary: Cell Phone Signal Booster Works Great

reviewText: I live in a strange area for recption. TV / Radio / Cell - everything. I've had all the providers over the past few years and none have ever given more the minimumal call quality. Wasn't a major problem, as the call quality was "good 'nuff" and I didn't want to spend $$$'s to setup a full blown repeater system.But (there's always a but), just as I was scheduled to spend 4 weeks working from home (I usually work at client site) my providor lost a cell tower. And even though I have a total of 3 towers within a 10 mile radius and will map as a "peak" service area, cell service went from 1-2 bars to no bars. Tower was on repair list, but we were suffering. Again, didn't want to spend the $$$'s for a temporary solution.Found the Mobile Pro with positive technical reviews on a couple of tech sites, and the price here was acceptable, even if the use was expected to be temporary. Ordered, received a couple of days later, and following the instructions set up the system. And went from almost no signal to a solid 2 and mostly 3 bars of signal strength. I was back in business.Caveats, will handle multiple devices but each additional will reduce smplification. Don't recommend for more than 2 a time. Worked well for my mobile and fixed station devices, but started to drop when my wifes mobile was added. Need to keep any devices within a 2-3 foot radius of the repeater and the antenna needs some distance.But, it works as advertised, and I will be using in the car for trips and the occasional service failure at home.
summary: Poor cell reception? Went from 0 to 2-3 bars signal!

reviewText: I was looking forward to getting this Wilson Electronics cell phone signal booster because I've struggled for years with poor cell phone reception in my basement. However, after I hooked this thing up, I noticed very little, if any, improvement in my reception. At first I thought I might've hooked it up wrong, so I unhooked-rehooked it up a total of three times, with the same results. On occasion, I can see a temporary one-bar increase in my reception, but that's the exception, not the norm. The vast majority of the time, my basement reception is still horrible. Maybe there are other factors at play (my cellular carrier, house construction, etc.), but the minimal benefit from this product in my particular situation is the reason for my 3-star review.

I travel through the countryside frequently, and always have areas where I drop calls or can't get data on my phone. I've seen those cheap signal boosters you put into your phone on ebay, and they just don't work. So needless to say, I was skeptical that a product like a the Wilson signal booster could really work for me. And I was wrong - mostly.If used properly, this signal booster should significantly decrease all frustration you once had with dropped calls and low signal problems. Since installing this in my car, I have dropped roughly 90% fewer calls. My bars went from 1 to 4 instantly as it was plugged in. My call quality improved dramatically too - once where there was static is now a clear conversation.The antenna itself is a little unsightly, especially when used in a car.  You need to put the antenna on your roof, and have the cable running through an open window.  I was able to shut my window just about all the way with it, so it shouldn't be much of a problem in winter. Unsightly - yes. Does it work - YES.*edit*I used it this winter, and though my car never got really cold inside, there was a constant whistling from the window being cracked open that drove me crazy.  So keep that in mind.I've also tried this antenna in various hotels that did not offer wifi. I have a Verizon card I plug in to my laptop to get 3g, but in some areas I travel, I was lucky to get 1X speeds. I just hooked up the signal booster and put the receiver within a couple of feet of my laptop, and wham - instant 3g coverage with pretty consistent coverage And the nice this is that it amplifies every signal within 2 feet. So if I'm using it for my laptop and also need to take a call, I get great reception on my phone as well. But that 2 feet is pretty specific - if you go outside of that range, it definitely drops off significantly. And it's not always consistent within 2 feet - sometimes you have to play around to find the right location.All in all, this is the best solution I've come across yet for low signal issues. It's not perfect, but it's far better than the other alternatives I've tried thus far. Keeping in mind its limitations (proximity to unit, inconsistent with signal, need to crack open window to use it in the car), it may be worth it for some people. It may be a bit pricey, but is definitely worth it if you have low signal problems.
summary: Works very well for me, but inconsistent results

reviewText: The device works well in a hotel room where signal is weak. I have been consistently able to get a better signal, with this booster versus using it without, so it definitely works. But, don't expect to go from one or no bars to four or five bars. From my experience, a proper set improves an extra bar or two, maximum.Here are some tips to use this booster effectively:1. You have to be within 2 feet of the transmitter for your phone to realize any improvement.2. Make sure the antenna is far enough away from the base -- if they're too close, it creates a feedback loop and the booster won't work properly. There's an LED on the unit that illuminates either amber or green -- amber means you need to reposition the antenna farther away from the base unit and green means the unit is operating properly.By the way, be aware, if you used this in a car, it would be a little messy with all those wires and vent clamps.Overall, I am very satisfied and highly recommend it to anyone needing a signal boost for improved sound and clarity.
summary: It does improve my cell phone reception.

reviewText: This was pretty easy to set up and definitely helped improve my iPhone reception. Since I live far from a metro area, I really do need the extra boost for my phone signal. It doesn't give me a huge boost, but it does give me that little extra juice to help maintain a cell call.The product arrived in a hard to open clamshell of plastic. Once I was able to fish out the components, it was simple to figure out the set up itself. You stick the antenna magnet on the metal antenna housing, use the suction cups to position the antenna, plug the booster into the wall, and place the booster on a table near your cell phone.Don't expect to go from one or no bars to four or five bars. From my experimenting, a proper set gives me an extra bar or two, maximum. So if I have zero bars normally, I can actually get a signal and make a call. if i have a very wear signal of one bar, I might end up with two. The difference between zero bars and two bars is WELL WORTH the price of the product.I'm very happy with the cell booster - with the ease of set up and use, and in gaining the ability to make a call in places where I might not be able to otherwise. As long as you are not expecting crystal clear strong booster ability, one should be happy with the product.
summary: Not a huge boost, but enough juice to make a call in weak cell areas

reviewText: I tries several different spots through out my home and it just could get a good signal to replicate. I will try another brand to see if it works.

Ok, so that's not a very dignified title, I know.  But holy cow!  I've been so disappointed in my laptop's download performance for months even though the signal quality was listed as "excellent".  It took forever to bring up a website.  I hooked up this booster behind my desk and my old fogie computer performance seems like a babe again.  Much faster.  My cellphone also went from the normal 2 bars to 3.  Setup was easy and only took minutes.  I'm not about to put it in my car because talking on the phone and driving can be a deadly combination.

We live in a rural area that has spotty-to-no-coverage.  We can lose a call just by dropping over a hill.  These boosters have helped, but we're not seeing a jump from 'no service' to '4 bars' or anything like that.  If we have 1-bar when we start, the booster doesn't give more bars, but it will help hold the call (we won't drop it where we usually do).
summary: Not outstanding, but it can help.

reviewText: I was skeptical of these cell phone boosters, figuring they're about as useless as those gold colored antenna stickers they used to sell on TV.  And if you're reading this, you're probably wondering the same thing, so lets get right to it:Does it actually work?YES!  My Sprint cell phone gets decent signal at home without this booster -- usually between 2 - 5 bars out of a possible 6.  But with this booster, I'm rock-solid at 5 - 6 bars at home.  At work, my cell phone reception is pretty dismal -- fluctuating from 0 - 3 bars at best -- so I was eager to see if this booster would improve that.  And guess what -- it did!  With this booster, I'm now at a consistent 2 - 4 bars while at work, so that's a pretty good improvement.No brainer setupI think the strongest selling point of this cell phone signal booster is the easy setup -- just plug it into a USB port, cigarette lighter or electrical outlet, then attach the antenna and place it in a window -- done!The only part that might cause a hiccup is making sure the antenna is far enough away from the base -- if they're too close, it creates a feedback loop and the booster won't work properly.  There's an LED on the unit that illuminates either amber or green -- amber means you need to reposition the antenna farther away from the base unit and green means the unit is operating properly.  But this minor setup requirement really shouldn't pose much of an issue.  I've had the antenna and booster as close as 5' from each other and it still lit green and functioned properly.RangeThe manufacturer says this booster was intended to be used no more than 2 feet away from your cell phone, and I'd say that's pretty accurate.  I don't need to move my phone very far before it loses connection with the booster and it has no effect whatsoever.  A slightly longer range might have been nice, but I guess I can just leave my phone next to the booster and use a bluetooth headset if I want to move around.At this point, I'm planning on using this with my laptop on the go, so I don't think the 2' limit will be an issue for me.  But I'm also considering using this in my car -- velcroing it to my dash and then velcroing my phone cradle on top of the booster, making the 2' range a non issue in that configuration.  But I have to decide where I need it most though, since I don't want to keep setting it up in the car only to remove it again for use with my laptop.Carrying CaseThis Wilson booster comes with a carrying case to make transport easy.  There's really not a whole lot to carry but it's still a nice touch.  Having said that, I'd rather have had a shorter case; as it is, it's needlessly long.  I assume it's meant to be a one size fits all solution for an array of Wilson products, perhaps accommodating kits with longer antennas.  But for this setup, the long case is a bit awkward considering this product is meant to be portable.  A minor quibble, but I think others would agree once they have it in hand.Form FactorNot a very attractive product really.  Just a battleship gray rectangular box and a stubby antenna.  Maybe something more appealing to look at would be a cool touch.  Docked a star for the uninspired design.  As it is, the design makes it obvious this costs nothing to produce which makes me question the hefty price tag.Things that make you go hmmmmmm....If cell phone radiation is a health risk, are booster antennas also a cause for concern??  Who knows; but it makes me wonder.  Maybe the 2' range is a good thing after all.Bottom LineIf you need a signal boost for your cell phone then this Wilson should do the trick.  Just be sure you don't need to wander more than 2 feet away from the booster; that, or be prepared to use it in conjunction with a bluetooth headset.  My Sprint phone got a stable boost of around 2 bars and the signal doesn't fluctuate as much in problem areas.  Thumbs up!

Made in the USA, the Wilson Electronics 801242 MobilePro cell phone signal booster was designed to increase cellular signals up to 6 times, reduce disconnects and dropouts, and increase data communication rates for 3G devices.Upon receiving the Wilson Electronics signal booster, I opened the package and looked at the various pieces.  Opening the installation guide, I attempted to quickly connect the signal booster in an attempt to test its capabilities.  Unfortunately the installation guide doesn't provide organized instructions for a quick install.  Installing isn't difficult, besides needing to know the antennae must be connected prior to the power, the rest is simple and intuitive.  I'm baffled as to why the install instructions are so kludgy and doesn't reflect this.Once I reviewed the install guide and took note of the warnings, I set up the signal for use indoors.  I set up the antennae first, stretched the cord a little over 8 foot away (recommended for indoor use), and placed the booster next to my wirelessly connected laptop.  There was a slight delay, but the signal gauge improved and decreased with each plug in and disconnect respectively.The Wilson Electronics 801242 MobilePro cell phone signal booster has a steep price, limiting those who would be willing to purchase this solution.  For me, it's a matter of productivity; I could easily justify the expense.  If you can justify the expense, and the install configuration isn't a problem for you, this signal booster is worthy of your consideration.PROS:Provides improved 800/1900 MHz cell signalSupports multiple 3G device simultaneouslyDerives power from outlet, USB connection, or lighter socketSimple to install and use1 year warranty with 30 day money back guarantyCONS:Kludgy install guideDoesn't work with iDEN/Nextel cell phones or cellular-based data cardsApproved use limited to the USA and Canada
summary: Super Amped: A Wilson Electronics 801242 MobilePro Cell Phone Signal Booster Review

reviewText: We live in a metropolitan area with spotty signals from every cell service we've tried over the years, and even the satellite radio service we used to have. Come around the bend and, oops! Gone. But it seems like that all depends on which way the wind is blowing. There is probably something more technical than wind direction involved in the service drops, but I'm not positive there is.I hoped that this gadget would set the service straight and steady. But did the Wilson boost the signal or were we just having a good day? Hard to say. While it was engaged, we never lost signal, but I can't say that the signal was improved, either. Maybe the bars on my phone lifted by one just because, or maybe they lifted because I pulled the phone away from my head to look and happened to angle the phone just right, thereby grabbing a better signal. From the Wilson? Could be.This was tough to review because it's hard to say if anything useful was happening. We will be vacationing in an area with really bad cell service and after testing at that location, I will report back. Until then I leave the review at a neutral three-stars.

I bought this product because some of my company doesn't have cell boosters in all of the trucks yet. I am in south Texas working the oilfield and I get pretty good service from verizon at most times but this is a must have for your truck if you travel or experience low signal reception. No dropped calls at all. Plus I can hook it up in the RV as well the only thing is you have to be within 12 to 18" from the dash mount . I highly recommend this product.

I made sure this was compatible with my phone before i bought it and it is. This did not work for me at all. I was so excited when it arrived. i followed the instructions carefully and it still did not work, in fact it seemed to mess with my WiFi signal a little. do yourself a favor and dont buy this garbage. good thing i can get a refund.

This has been a great product for me. I live on a fringe area previously only served by HughesNet satellite internet or Verizon 1x and dialup. Verizon recently popped in a 3G tower several miles away over tough terrain and it has always been "almost" bearable. Now it is consistent available and fast for a fringe area. I've used this with a Pantech UM175 modem and the Novatel U760 modem now, both on a cradlepoint router and it has worked very well. The Pantech had a weaker radio than the Novatel but became usable with this Wilson booster. The Novatel U760 is consistently faster now than before without the booster. I have tried a competitors booster ($$$) previously and did not have as good of results despite going to great pains to run coax cable through my house outside and this compact, easy to setup unit blows it's doors off. Not only is it better it is more flexible. The booster receives power from an ac adapter for household usage, a car adapter for long term on the road usage and can also go straight USB form a pc. It came with all of the necessary cables for the booster power and antenna. It boosts signal wirelessly so there is no cable to connect to an aircard. I have had my best boost come from being less than 2' away from it which is perfect for my application. This booster does not broadcast over a large area nor is it advertised to. It is more of a "personal space" application if you will. My aircard is in a router that covers my residence and my RV when traveling so as long as it gets a boosted signal everybody gets to enjoy it.Living in a rural area I will be sure to recommend this to my neighbors as it is a real difference maker. I also work in remote areas doing environmental work frequently and look forward to having this in my arsenal for field communications.

When I ordered this device I really thought it was going to be some small device that conveniently fit in my home or car and was easily portable. I was a bit surprised when the package showed up and it was a lot bigger than I originally envisioned.There are a few parts to this device. The basic package includes the wireless Mobile Pro amplifier, the USB power cable and the cigarette lighter power supply with USB connection and is really only intended for use in a car.The amplifier itself is a little box roughly the size of an average mobile phone. By its name you can see that it's used to amplify the signal. It's recommended that you mount this rather large device on your dashboard, but the instructions do give you the option of attaching it to the back of your headrest if you need to boost your signal even more. Anything that's labeled a cell phone booster that is designed to sit directly behind my head... I'm leery of. Also, I found it amusing that this was a wireless amplifier, yet it came with a wire to run from the "wireless amplifier" to the cigarette lighter plug. I guess they had to power it someway, but the term wireless is a bit misleading.In addition to the basic package I also got the in-home accessory kit with AC power supply and window bracket, along with a mini magnet mount antenna. It's unclear if they sell this all together or not, but the instructions clearly indicate that these are a separate purchase item.The first thing I did was take this all apart and use it in the living room. I was a little surprised when I was setting this up to read that the antenna and the amplifier had to be at least 8 feet away from each other to prevent oscillation (whatever that means). Luckily the antenna came with an 8 foot cable to connect to the wireless amplifier. So I have the antenna on the window and 8 feet away I have the power amplifier on a table, and a few feet further I have the thing plugged into the wall. My wife takes one look and says simply "no", so I know this can't stay mounted like it is.But did it work? Yes - I was getting five bars across the phone on two different cellular networks. I considered this a complete success and made a few test calls. to make sure it worked. The only disappointing part came when I finally took down the system and realized that I was pretty much getting five bars of signal without the antenna. To be fair - I did get the signal coming and going without the antenna, so I would definitely say that this was an improvement.Taking this in the car was a similar story.I went on a trip and took this with me. Mine came with a portable bag that I could put all the pieces in and carry with me. It was actually rather large in my suitcase, so I wasn't impressed with its portability. When I did get to my destination, my brother picked me up in his hard top convertible. Since he had the top down, I began to see that this wasn't going to work. Eventually I got a rental SUV so I had another chance to test it out. Again, the antenna has to be 8 feet away from the amplifier, so the SUV had plenty of room for me to run wires to the back of the car and then out the window up to the roof. I even placed it on the center of the roof as the instructions suggest - although the cord hanging off looked silly and was clearly a temporary solution. Since it was a rental I didn't want to permanently affix the amplifier so I sat it upright on the seat next to me. To be fair here, they do have other optional mount-solutions available where you can take it on the road more easily.Did it work in the car? Again, I got five bars (only testing one network this time though). It was fairly consistent and overall I was happy with the function, if not the form. Would I have gotten 5 bars anyway? I'm not sure, but I never dropped a call when I was out of the car... So I'm not sure how much this was the amplifier working, or me really wanting the amplifier to work.So - final result? It seemed to do just what it was advertised to do. Did I get the occasional hesitation when talking? Maybe once or twice, but overall I thought I could hear pretty clearly, and I always had a strong signal strength. I could give it five stars on the functional part alone.But the form factor killed me. Long wires, multiple pieces, suction cups.. It was a bit bummed that I had to set up my own base station antenna to get it functional. In the SUV it was fine, but the convertible was a non-starter. Smaller cars I also imagine that you'd have trouble getting the 8 feet or separation.The instructions were clear enough, and mine came with a little video clip to show me how to hook it up, so I wouldn't say it was hard, but it was just time consuming. I'd give it three stars for design (and I think I'm being generous. I would have definitely kicked it up a star or even two if there was an option to slap a battery in it and just use the amplifier piece by itself, but the competition for my cigarette lighter plug outlet is too great.Other parting shots:-Okay, I guess the bag to carry it wasn't that big, but it was too big to fit in my carryon backpack, so it has to go in the suitcase.-I ended up putting it back in the house behind the curtain to hide it - so far the wife hasn't thrown it out the window.-The AC adapter is 110-220 so it works overseas. that is assuming that where you're going is one of the only two bands that the device supports.-Two weeks after I got it - I still hate the design.
summary: Function over form. It works - It just looks ugly.

reviewText: I travel for business quite a bit and conduct much of my work on my cell phone.  I have run into "dead spots" (areas where cell phone signals are weak) fairly often.  I also use a wireless internet card for my computer since some hotels charge up to $20 a day for their wireless. I seem to have the most problems when I am on the coast and have room near the ocean (no towers on the water).  I have also run into problems in cars but I have recently decided not to use my phone while driving.  I was hoping that this product would help me and I am happy to say that it does.Last week I was staying at a hotel that had a really poor cell phone signal.  I hooked up the booster and immediately received a stronger signal (1 more bar than before).  I then hooked up the antenna and BAM! full strength on my 3G phone.  I turned on the computer and my 3G wireless card was up and running as well.  This will make my life easier.  One complaint is that you have to be very close to the booster box itself (I tend to pace when I talk on the phone and now I have to sit still).  Other than that I think that it is great.
summary: A very helpful product for "dead" spots

reviewText: As the subject says, item received was new and sealed. I purchased it from Eleven Adar seller.
summary: New and sealed and on time

reviewText: An official blackberry product works in the blackberry curve and the external charger as well. Have no complaints - can't expect it to exceed the capabilities of my phones original battery

I went to great lengths to make sure I bought the 33 dollar one direct from Amazom. It came with Blackberry packaging and authentic looking markings. 2 weeks in it's already failing to hold a charge throughout the day. I don't know if it's related or not but the unit now seems to reboot spontaneiously once every other day or so- I'm talking the full 10 minute reboot too, not just a soft restart. Really unhappy with Amazon on this one. I bought a cheaper one about a month ago that was bad right out of the box. Why is it so hard to just get a real battery to replace the OEM one?

Nothing about the packaging or the battery as delivered by the seller would lead me to believe that the battery I received was not an OEM BlackBerry battery. I ordered this battery as a replacement for my wife's phone. She went from about 2 days of light usage before having to charge to making sure the phone was on the charger every night. After installing this battery it seemed to help a bit, but she may have been having an issue with a social network updating app running in the background. She hasn't complained about it since "fixing" that issue so I'm giving this a fair review of it's neither bad nor good as it is exactly as described.One note, my seller sent the item in a "sealed" bag. In other words the battery did not come in retail packaging. It was instead in a plastic bag that had a sticker "seal" on it.  This reminded me of the type of packaging that I receive when ordering many types of OEM computer replacement parts; they'd come in a brown box or a static bag. This battery arrived in similar fashion. As I have read on other reviews it has been described as shady, this was nothing of the sort.
summary: I Think It's The Same As OEM

reviewText: I purchased this item from Amazon at less than a quarter of the price for which the official BB Online Store is offering the same item.  It is an exact duplicate of the battery that came with my BB and I carry it around in case of a power emergency.
summary: BB Tour 9630 battery at a great price.

reviewText: I bought these for our Blackberry 8900 users that travel and thus need a spare battery in their bag.  They are OEM from the folks at RIMM (Blackberry).  No quality issues...they are real and work as they should.
summary: Original Equipment from Blackberry - For Storm and 8900

reviewText: I was having a lot of trouble with my Blackberry Storm (version 1).  Finally, I ordered this battery since mine was going dead and malfunctioning during the day.  I was ready to slam the Storm against a brick wall.  This battery was new in packaging when it arrived and mostly solved my troubles with the Storm.  I ordered a second as a spare due to the low price, but really haven't needed it.  My friends have all run to Droids and 4g, but I'm getting new life from a device I paid good money for.  It does everything I need it to do just as when I bought it.  Plus, if I wait a week or two the 5g, 6g, or 9g network will be out with yet another new and improved phone operating system . . .
summary: Made my antique Blackberry storm new again.

reviewText: Lithium batteries have alimited life of about 3-years, so correct recharging is essential to maximum usage.  This spare battery allows me to cycle the original battery and this one to keep them effectively charged to assure that they last as long as possible. Buying a fresh battery from the RIM source is important. I am very pleased with this one.  Don't buy cheap lithium batteries or extra spares that you do not use.  In 3-years they are dead, regardless.
summary: New Lithium battery for Blackberry Tour 9360

reviewText: The battery fit well, and has worked well.  The price was good.  I recommend it.  I use it with a charging station to carry for backup power if needed.
This battery was just as stated oem and worked good in my blackberry. Battery life still is aweful because it is a crap phone but Thanks!
I purchased this as a replacement to keep my Storm2 going.  It did not last as long as the original, but got the job done.  for the price, it was worth it..

I can say good things about this product but hey my company still uses blackberry, its pretty hard to put a lot of credibility to someone still using a BB, you would think my wheels on my car are made of stone!
great replacement battery does its job

reviewerName: Wandrwoman "Wise as Aphrodite, Beautiful as A...
reviewText: This is supposed to be an OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer)battery that is identical to the battery that came with my Blackberry Bold 9650. It was purchased from the Battery King and it appears to be identical to the original battery. It arrived almost fully charged and it is behaving just like a brand new battery should. It charges quickly and holds its charge for several days of use.  The price is many, many times less than for the battery sold by Verizon so I am more than a little suspicious however I have absolutely no complaints. Quite frankly, I am delighted!
summary: A Fountain of Youth for an Aging Blackberry

reviewText: Ive had this case for over a week now and i truly love it, sleek design, fits great.. just love it..

I have the white iphone and ordered a white color elago case to go with it. From the picture it looks nice but in reality, it's cheaply manufactured plastic junk. IT'S PLASTIC covered in white paint and the plastic edge rough and will scratch you iphone. Spend some more money and get a better casing.
summary: save time and money. skip this junk

reviewText: This case doesn't detract from the look of my iPhone 3GS at all while protecting it. I've had it for 2 months now and am very satisfied.

The shiny black cover resembles the back of the iPhone. I like that the silver lining is showing with this cover. The cover stays on securely.  Will somewhat protect your iPhone in case of a drop. I recommend another leather case for situations where you want total iPhone protection in case of a drop.
summary: Looks like the real back of the black iPhone

reviewText: This case gets the job done but is not the best case I have invested in. The hole for the camera is very small which allows for a lot of back-flash.

the case fits great but it only covers the back of the iphone. the chrome border is very exposed and still prone to scratches. the case also makes it hard to reach for the volume buttons. decent cheap case overall.

I think that this case is pretty cool.It is almost invidible.But the only bad part is it doesn't protect the silver or buttons.Other than that if your on a budget andwant to protect the back of your phone, get this.

I was amazed to find this on Amazon for such a good price. This case is the best one for the Iphone. I have dropped the phone twice and not a scratch on it and no problems with the phone. I would highly recommend this to anyone with an Iphone.The holster style belt broke in August and now I have to buy another whole unit even though I only need the holster. But the case is still great.

I bought a used Iphone with an otterbox and clip. I like the otterbox but has one flaw. The belt clip does not sure the phone very well. I suggest the  Seidio Innocase Rugged Case and Holster Combo for Use with iPhone 3G/3GS (Black)over the otterbox. The otterbox works well for my wife but if you need to attach it to your belt I would purchase the Seidio.Thanks Jeff.
summary: Otterbox Good but lacking in the belt clip.

reviewText: I loved this, it was so durable. I have now gone to the I phone IV. Do not use it anymore.

I first purchased theIncipio SILICRYLIC  V3 Case for iPhone 3G, 3G S (Midnight Blue), which was nice, but over time, the hard plastic part of the case wore holes in the silicone part and it just wasn't as protective as the otterbox cases. Then, I purchased theOtterBox Impact Case for iPhone 3G, 3G S (White)which was great for the money, but it stretched after only 2 months and covered the sensors which made the screen not come on when it was suppose to. So, after seeing so many people with this one, I broke down and purchased it. I am so happy that I did. I noticed that there is a small smudge between the screen protector and the actual screen, it's nothing bad at all, but I wanted to mention it. This case is so nice and I highly recommend it, so far.
summary: The best iphone case on the market, by far

reviewText: Pictures would have you believe this a near mil-spec case, protecting your phone from shock, moisture and dirt. Not even close.  Specifics...Once assembled around the phone, the unit easily falls out of included belt clip.  The two little ears on the belt clip do not securely hold the phone and case in place.  At best, this is a case you store in your pocket or purse, although the case makes the phone quite bulky.  With the phone in the case, the charge cord cannot be connected, or at least we can't get any of the multiple chargers we own to work (we own 11 I Phones).  The outer rubber housing, meant to absorb shock is thin...far thinner than standard Otter Box soft phone cases and the inner yellow shell is made of hard, unyielding plastic, so I doubt if this case offers much real protection if your IPhone is dropped from any height.  This is one, poorly conceived design meant, I suspect to look tough but not much else.  The Otterbox Defender Series 3 case fails in every way and given how poorly it performs, it is grossly overpriced to boot.

Just wanted to leave a quick review. This item is the best. I dropped my iphone in the rain ant the mail box and went to work, I realized I dropped it and went home 45 min past. My phone was still there and I wipped it off and it recieved 0 damage. Ive dropped it down the concrete stairs at work several times, my phone is still 0% damaged. I finaly ordered a new one becase I finaly managed to break the holster, which help up for a long time of abuse. I was a police officer and this case seen some rough times. Best buy award from me.

A friend of mine had this OtterBox Defender in all black.  She explained the entire case for me and it's multiple layers and I was definitely intrigued.  When I saw the case in Black/Yellow, I knew I just had to have it.  See, I am one of those people who drops her iPhone a lot.  I am so surprised the device has not broken at this point.  Since it hasn't, I decided that a little more "drop" protection was in order.  The case comes in layers:  the holster, the silicone layer and a hard plastic layer.Installation of the OtterBox is easy enough and was included on the package card which you will have to open up.  I decided to watch installation on a video on the OtterBox site.One of the main issues with this holder that has nagged many a user is the oily bubbles (for lack of a better word) that appear on the screen between the case and the iPhone.  There is a solution to this which I used right out of the package - use a quick puff of baby powder on the screen.  Not really enough to leave a huge residue but a puff.  There are instructions on YouTube which I followed and which work just great.Love the case.  Looks industrial and kind of cool but not so bulky that it won't fit in a pocket (I was pleasantly surprised as I thought it might be more bulky).  Regarding price, I don't think you will find it cheaper than this.  Thank you Amazon!5 stars!
summary: For the klutzy iPhone owner -- this case is tough!
